Reviews.Title: “Great For A Night In London”
Reviews.Author: RockyJohnnyB
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Threadneedles before, so no surprises for us here. Why did we come back? Several reasons: (1) good central location, right next to Bank tube station. St Pauls and the Thames are both a short stroll away; (2) great attention to guests. we weren't happy with our room on this occasion and it was sorted for us instantly; (3) quality of hotel. well furnished and maintained, clean, good bed, bathroom etc, bar and restaurant just downstairs. polite and helpful staff At the weekend rooms can be secured at quite reasonable prices (for the capital). My only quibble would be that not all of the rooms are particularly big. But great for a night away

Reviews.Title: “very friendly and helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: TEK101
Reviews.Content: I stayed a seconed time at this hotel and the expierence was as good again as the first time. I really recommend this hotel: The combination of the location (direct in the City!) the quality of the rooms and the friendlyness of the staff make it my first choice!

Reviews.Title: “this is great”
Reviews.Author: safarimax
Reviews.Content: nice food and rooms and all clean. nice staff and no bad staff

Reviews.Title: “We're back, but a suite this time!”
Reviews.Author: hubhopper
Reviews.Content: We were here last year (April 2011) and thought we'd drop by again for a couple of nights. I booked this stay at short notice on a '2012' special offer which was a really good deal for the Livingstone Suite and a glass of very decent Champagne on arrival. Weekends in this central part of London are quiet, even the nearby shops are closed, but it doesn't take too much effort to get to the bright lights. We came back late Saturday afternoon and after a day's shopping to find the room had not been made up. We found out that rooms can be made up any time up until 6pm so if you're planning an evening at the theatre but are heading out for the day it might be worth mentioning to reception as you leave. Breakfast is still a triumph!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place at the Price paid”
Reviews.Author: Tony629
Reviews.Content: Got a great weekend deal as this hotel is near the Hyde Park, 2 minutes to tube which is handy. The rooms are very clean. Staffs are polite and decent. It was the best stay at the price paid. It's a lovely hotel, Service great; Stayed Feb 2012, travelled as a couple

Reviews.Title: “Very elegant, and chic”
Reviews.Author: Jjordan2112
Reviews.Content: Be aware on the weekend ,most things in the areas are closed, it can feel like a ghost town. However the bank tube is a minutes walk away. The surroundings and staff are fabulous, however there is no lead ire club and little ' extra facilties' other that the very nice rooms, and bar. Be careful, easy to miss the front door - tucked away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but take earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: Hoolit
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a Saturday night deal with my daughter and enjoyed the ambience of the hotel. The staff were all charming, the lounge with stained glass cupola is wonderful and our executive room struck the right balance between style and comfort. However, the sound insulation in our room (214) was very poor and we were woken at 3am by prolonged noise from the room above, which was embarrassing to say the least!

Reviews.Title: “Favourite hotel bar none”
Reviews.Author: Implenia
Reviews.Content: Best stay at the hotel in London bar none. Impeccable service. Itâ€™s great value for weekends as rate are lower.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite 5 star”
Reviews.Author: MissPennyapple
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel direct through the Threadneedles website, as it was a good deal for the weekend and included a Studio Suite room. I had high expectations for the room, given it was a studio room, and having looked at the photos on the website of the studio they were advertising, it looked very nice and spacious. Arriving at the hotel, the service was impeccable. The public areas of the hotel are beautiful, and the staff are friendly and attentive. The room however, was a little disappointing. Although the room was lovely and was very clean, there were just a few things that I felt let it down, and made it not quite 5 star luxury it was billed as. I actually had to ask if we had been put in a studio room, as I thought it was a little smaller than expected. There was far too much furniture in the room, and you had to be careful not to bump into the table or the chair when walking through the room. The furniture itself was on the verge of needing replaced, being quite chipped and worn, where people had obviously walked into it! The room lamps didn't match at either side of the bed, and the pictures on the wall next to the bed were hung so low that the huge bedside lamp completely obstructed them. It just looked a bit thrown together and lacking in attention to detail. Although the bedding seemed to be changed everyday, on 2 of the days the duvet cover had rips in it, which just looked shabby. The blanket covering the bed also had a stain on it, but as I never used it I couldn't be bothered asking for a new one. The room temperature was also a problem. It was not warm! Although we had the air con turned up full heat and the blower turned down, the room remained cool the whole time we were there. I asked reception if it could be adjusted, they looked into it and said they had 'fixed' it, but they obviously hadn't, as there was no change in the room temp. Breakfast was very nice, and the cooked breakfast was very good. No buffet, just 2 choices if you book the deal on the website - a cooked breakfast with toast OR pastries, or a continental, which came with both toast AND pastries. I thought this was a rather odd way to do things, making the guest having the cooked breakfast choose whether they wanted toast or pastries. In all the hotels I've stayed in, toast is standard! Just seemed a bit mean to me! But that was a small niggle, overall, the food was lovely and a nice dining experience. We were meant to have a glass of champagne on arrival, but this was missed by the staff checking us in. When we were checking out, we were asked if we had enjoyed our champagne, to which we replied we didn't get our champagne. The staff member was very apologetic and the manager has since offered us a bottle of champagne on our next stay though. While we were there, the communication lines were unfortunately cut by the construction work in the building next to the hotel. We had no phones, TV or internet for 2 days. Although the management did apologise, and it obviously wasn't anything the hotel could fix, it would have been nice to have been offered something to make up for this. A complimentary drink in the bar for example. But nothing was offered. Although it was a small inconvenience for us as we were on holiday and out sightseeing during the day, it would have been very inconvenient for anyone on a business trip, for example. In summary, the room was very clean, good service and food, and a beautiful hotel. But there were just too many little things that made this hotel feel not quite up to the 5 stars it has. I would say, it was more like a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive... and love the Fedora!”
Reviews.Author: Member100
Reviews.Content: From the Fedora-clad doorman to the stunning dome, I immediately felt I was going to like Threadneedles. I was assigned a large room down a side corridor with only one room opposite (Iâ€™d requested a quiet one), with a very comfortable bed (only one demonic scatter cushion), proper usable desk, lots of power points including a European one, and a big armchair with footstool. The room itself was quiet and I didnâ€™t hear much apart from occasional distant door slamming, and the person in the room opposite (more belowâ€¦). There was a massive bathroom - one of the nicest Iâ€™ve seen in hotels, with a separate rainhead shower to the bath (which also had a handheld shower) and generous amounts of gorgeous Korres toiletries. Some additional nice touches: magazines in the bathroom (Instyle, FHM, not boring tourist ones), a choice of free still or sparkling water for the night, curtains properly shut during turndown so that no light peeped through, and some small suggestions around the room of room service offers and treats, which were subtly done. Two irritants that can be addressed: 1) The bathroom has large opaque windows with no blinds and an opaque glass door. As a result, light streams through from very early in the morning. Easily solved by blind on the door. I gather theyâ€™re doing a soft refurb, so hopefully theyâ€™ll address this. 2) A nutty person in the room opposite having a screaming one-sided row until about 1am. It wasnâ€™t as loud once I was round the corner in bed, but still irritatingly and definitely audible. Not the hotelâ€™s fault, but Iâ€™d so love a door/double door to the room that blocks out corridor noiseâ€¦ Having said that, if thereâ€™d been someone vaguely considerate opposite, then it wouldâ€™ve been more than ok. Iâ€™ve stayed in quite a few hotels in London, and this was also close as itâ€™s got to being spot on for me. I think I may have found a home from homeâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Good but a bit of honesty would have been nice ...”
Reviews.Author: CheshireFieldings28
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the 10th February 2012. I booked into an Executive Room and ordered a romantic package as it was my husband's birthday. The package was lovely - champagne, chocolates, bubble bath and rose petals. We ordered room service, very nice and very efficient. Room was a good size and ensuite had a bath and shower. Bed and pillows very comfortable. Staff were very friendly and attentive and breakfast was fantastic! The only complaint I have would a bit of honesty when booking. There is currently a lot of building work going on adjacent to the hotel hence our view was nothing but scaffolding which was obviously why our curtains were drawn when we arrived despite it being about 3.30 in the afternoon! We were awoke at 8am on Saturday morning to drilling and banging from the workman. It would have been nice if we'd have been told when booking that this work was going on. When reported in the morning they took my number and said a Manager would be in touch - nothing yet.

Reviews.Title: “Back again and still consistently excellent.”
Reviews.Author: HughK1
Reviews.Content: I have reviewed Threadneedles before. Any hotel that can deliver great service stay after stay is a rare commodity. The Shackleton Suite is great if you can swing it. Bonds is the best breakfast in the Square Mile still. Keep it up team!

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Millarmaid
Reviews.Content: Having seen this hotel on a recent documentary we decided to give it a go for a weekend break. We were not disappointed. Our 2012 deal gave us a beautiful suite and a glass of champagne. Just a short walk from the tube and we thought easy to find. The room was lovely- 3TV's (and only 2 of us) a seperate shower and bath. Lovely warm towels, great toiletries. A 6 foot bed. We had a lovely dinner on the Friday in the restaurant (Bonds) and bar meals on the Saturday (the restaurant is closed over the weekend). The cocktails are many and varied. This area of London shuts down at weekends so its beautifully quiet. Shops, bars, restaurants are only a short bus/tube ride away. We walked to the Guildhall to see the Roman amphitheatre and the art gallery, to St Paul's (and a nice lunch) followed by the excellent Museum of London. All walkable. And for us the magic continued with snow. Breakfast (included on our deal) was very good. If you are on a deal you have a choice of continental or cooked. I was slightly disappointed that i couldn't have my usual cereal followed by poached egg- but never mind. All in all an excellent weekend destination. I do think that during the week this would be a very busy place so perhaps not such good value.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel”
Reviews.Author: kelly h
Reviews.Content: Booked through last minute.com as a secret hotel and so did not know where we would be staying untill 30 mins from paying the full amount. Took us an hour to find the hotel! We used google maps on my iphone which took us the correct way but the hotel has no flags outside or anything advertising the name, also the number was 5 and the rest of the street had higher numbers so very confusing. If you book this hotel take advice if your struggling to find it and call them someone will come meet you! Very impressed when we arrived they were more than helpful, dissapointed to hear that the bar and restaurant was closed due to improvements as we had not been advised of this. Lifts had to be used by room card by security which we thought was very good idea. Rooms are fabulous! big comfy bed, tv in the bathroom! also good idea was an umbrella in the wardrobe for you to use. Only downside to stayin this area on a weekend is that everything is closed, only open Mon till Fri. This did not bother us as we just jumped on the tube to another station but it may put some people off. Very fast checkout and they offered to keep out suitcase till later so we could make the most of the day before returning home. Overall very impressed with the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: LincolnHairyBear
Reviews.Content: Booked Threadneedles Hotel via Lastminute .com's secret hotels. I had a good idea that this was the hotel and was happy to try it. It was excellent. The service was impeccable, friendly and willing, nothing was too much trouble despite the fact we were there 'on the cheap'. The beds are fabulous and the whole place reaked of old world class with modern touches that are not out of place. The review by Tom - Ireland is staggering! He perhaps has no experience of 5* hotels (by the way Tom, the air con had 1 dial for low, medium and high fan speed, plus another dial for temperature!) and what to expect from them. If I could get the same price deal again I would always stay here. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, excellent Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Sarah L
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely weekend break in London for a special birthday treat, went to the theatre, dinner and all things London. We stayed at Threadneedles on the Saturday evening, a short tube ride from the theatre district. The room was very comfortable, the staff extremely courteous and helpful and Sunday breakfast divine end to a perfect trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, awful service”
Reviews.Author: Tom_Ireland2
Reviews.Content: Wonderful central location. Awful service, snooty air which - whilst befitting the area - was amplified by the staff. Thoroughly useless when contacted about the temperature of the room. Would have been better at a travel lodge. The cleaners were tip top, however.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant 5-Star Luxury Boutique Hotel in the City - but no gym!”
Reviews.Author: Johnny_C_NYC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last year - it's a very nice boutique hotel tucked away down a small sidestreet (Thredneedle Street) right in the heart of the City. Great location for work, and there are plenty of shops and restaurants around the area too (Paul Smith, Brooks Brothers right next door, etc). My room was very modern, spacious, clean and had a very nice modernized but classy decor. The bathroom is large and has a shower and tub. The bed was very comfortable as well. The lobby is quite classy and the lounge/dining area is very well done with beautiful wood furniture and finishings - you really feel like you are in an upscale London hotel, that feels old but looks new (if that's possible!). Loved the Honor Bar and used it nightly - just remember to pay!! The scene at night later around the bar is always interesting with an interesting well-dressed crowd of business and holiday travelers! The Pacific Oriental restaurant just down the street is a pretty good place for lunch too. All in all I would highly recommend this hotel - about the only complaint I have is the lack of the gym which for me is usually a must, but having said that you are allowed access to a very nice gym located just down the street...but in winter that can be a daunting prospect if you're trying to get in a workout before hitting the office!! I would give this hotel a 4.75 out of 5, but its surely in the 5-star category due to the service and general amenities, and would stay there again. It's quite pricey I belive but I was there for work so did not have to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LouthLady
Reviews.Content: Great location in a lovely area 3 mins walk from Bank tube station on the central line & 6 mins walk from Liverpool street station on the central line, Metropolitan, Hammersmith & City, Circle tube lines. Lovely hotel didnâ€™t eat anything apart from free apples in the room!

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent 5 Star Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: clambake33
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in London on business and pleasure. Threadneedles would be among my top 2 favorites with Claridges being the other. The rooms and bathrooms are beautiful, modern and large by London standards with the amenities that you would expect at a 5 Star Hotel. You will not find a more comfortable bed in London. The staff of the hotel is wonderful. They really care about their guests and it shows in the little things that they do to make your stay very pleasant experience. It is a little quiet in the City on weekends, but I welcome the respite. The Bank Tube Station is 2 minute walk and you can get anywhere in the City from Bank. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not cheap but worth the money”
Reviews.Author: tdeprins
Reviews.Content: I usually book this hotel because it is within walking distance of the London exchange, but this hotel is really very good by London standards also for a romantic outing or a city trip. Staff is very friendly, rooms are always perfectly clean, very trendy/modern and spacious. I love the lobby and the decent wines served in the honesty bar. Never dined in the restaurant, but the room service meal was very good.

Reviews.Title: “A good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeanneey
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a luxury hotel that tick all the usual boxes: spacious, well equiped and modern room, sleek decor, good customer service, then the Threadneedles Hotel is for you. If you looking for something a little different, a hotel with a soul you might be a little disappointed. I went to this hotel with my partner to celebrate our anniversary and we booked a room directly with the hotel. The deal was very interesting as it was a weekend break and this hotel is very quiet during the weekend because of its location dead in the centre of the City of London. The service was very attentive but maybe a little too stereotyped to my taste. The room was nicely decorated with nice touches but somewhat very business like. I was expecting a boutique experience and I had a business experience instead. The big let down for us was the breakfast. Our booking was on a bed&breakfast basis. Those booking don't have the same breakfast as other clients. The quantity is less and the choice is reduced to two options: Full English or Continental. My partner is vegetarian and he ended up with a Full English with nothing on his plate apart from 2 eggs and toasts. A little disappointing for a 5 star hotel who apparently has the best rated cooked breakfast in town! All in all the experience was fine but somehow disappointing. I'm not sure I will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: Jersey_Alice
Reviews.Content: Our trip to the Treadneedles Hotel was to celebrate an anniversary and it was perfect. The hotel is sheer luxury, right from stepping in the front door there are welcoming staff who were more than happy to help with anything from recommending restaurants to suppling umbrellas when you completely forget to pick the one in your room up. The whole hotel is beautifully decorated, the lobby has the most amazing ceiling. The room was huge and had everything you could ever need in a hotel room, the view was of the building next door, not that shocking in london and to be honest...it didn't matter and didn't detract from the room or the experience at all. We had read before staying there that the breakfast was worth staying there alone....not a lie! The breakfast was very good, although the included package means you can choose either cereals and pastries or a cooked breakfast, there was more than enough with either choice that you didn't need both and if you choose the cooked option you can have either toast or pastries with it so it's like getting both anyway. Again, the staff are really happy to help and will sort out any changes you want to make. The location of the hotel will either suit you or not, for us it was perfect but i think it depends how well you know london and how happy you are making your way round. Being in 'the city' means that during the week it is bustling with life around the hotel but at the weekend pretty much every shop is closed. As i said, if you are happy getting around london then you will know that a 5 min walk one way is Liverpool Street Station which means Spitalfields and Brick Lane and a 5 min walk in the opposite direction is St. Paul's Cathedral and it's new massive Shopping Centre (which is open at the weekends). Our stay at the Threadneedles Hotel was a really special experience and i would love to return to sit in the bar and drink delicious cocktails before heading out to see a show and returning late to the comfiest bed. I wonder if this is a big enough hint?!

Reviews.Title: “Our fifth visit - the nicest hotel I know”
Reviews.Author: JulieB_9
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th consecutive year at Threadneedles for my husband's birthday which falls 3 weeks before Christmas. We have developed a routine of staying here for a Saturday night and being tourists in our own city just as it gears up for Christmas. I can't recommend Threadneedles highly enough - it has style and charm, the location is amazing, it has great transport links to the West End and breakfast in Bonds on a Sunday morning makes you feel special. This year we were in room 415 which was spacious, full of goodies and spotlessly clean. Thank you Threadneedles, please don't change. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “[--]”
Reviews.Author: bbwn82
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Threadneedles for a week while in the city on business. The location was very convenient for meetings in the City of London, and the hotel service was impeccable. While not a destination in itself, I would gladly return to this hotel when in London on business.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: dangerous dog
Reviews.Content: This has got to be one of the most beautiful reception/lounge areas of any hotel in London. We loved having cocktails and nibbles under the beautiful dome. We stayed for two nights at the weekend and it felt that no-one else was there. This is a hotel designed for bankers for expensve tastes and prices do rocket during the week. The hotel is very good value at the weekend if you can get a late deal. I think this is the best hotel I've stayed in anywhere in London.

Reviews.Title: “Little Oasis in the city”
Reviews.Author: briandurham6
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for Saturday night and everyone and everthing was to the highest standard. On booking in the staff were very good in finding us a room available although it was only 11am. The room although small had everthing you could possibly need including a TV in the bathroom. Toiletries and in room facilities were also very good. Although this is expensive in comparison to other hotels we would not hesitate to stay again

Reviews.Title: “In the square mile this is the best option - beautiful, boutique luxury hotel.”
Reviews.Author: HughK1
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at Threadneedles for many years and have never written a review. I was there recently and it's still as good as ever. The service is impeccable, the rooms are still top notch and the location if you are working is unbeatable. The restaurant Bonds is a bit of a money pit and not particularly that brilliant but it does do the best breakfast in town and the bar scene at night is always lively. It is a very, very good hotel and has been for years. The only word of warning for those that have not been to London before it's in the City and not the West End. I never consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeans-r-us
Reviews.Content: great hotel with a honesty bar and very nice rooms

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Luxury”
Reviews.Author: testcard
Reviews.Content: Booked this Hotel for a friday night as had business in London in the day so decided to meet my partner and have a night out. This hotel is bang in the heart of the city next to the Bank of England so generally makes its money through high-end business trade. As a result (and the fact that it's a tube ride from the main tourist spots) you can get very good deals on weekend nights. We paid Â£150 through Expedia (compared to weekday rates of around Â£290 to Â£400). For that price in London, this hotel is a bona-fide bargain. Everything in the rooms is done to a extremely high standard, the atrium and bar have a genuine wow factor (it has huge 19th century stained glass dome) and the staff are very professional and helpful. Yes, the area is quiet at the weekend but the hotel is within easy walking distance of the hipper parts of East London and on the doorstep of Bank station. I stay in London hotels quite a lot, but this is a cut above most.

Reviews.Title: “Quality,Quiet & Quite Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Theskellys
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure what this place is like during the week, but at the weekend it was a calm oasis in which to retreat after a day in the busy city. All the trappings of a 5* luxury hotel in our room with many exquisite and quality features,Too many to list here. I have absolutely no complaints about this hotel whatsoever. As for the location, I'm torn. I wished that this end of London didn't close down of a weekend. But because it does, it makes it a quiet location.So I guess I can't have both. There are many nearby pubs/bars and restaurant's that are worthy of a visit, sadly they close of a weekend . That said you're really only a tube ride away from hundreds of places. I would not hesitate on staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: themancUpNorth
Reviews.Content: Me and the wife spent 2 nights in the hotel as a weekend treat away from the kids. Don't really know what to say other than excellent hotel, service, facilities, atmosphere, location, staff. Have I missed anything? The only 2 negatives were 1. The integrated kettle in the room was broken and so we had to order hot water from room service until they brought a new standard kettle. We were offered a change of room because of the kettle! good eh. 2. The bathroom basin was cracked. I think it should really have been replaced at a hotel of this calibre. Again we were offered a change of room. Neither of these issues even minutely dented the overall fantastic time we had. Next time we go to London this will be the hotel to book.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasently exclusive”
Reviews.Author: happypete
Reviews.Content: London in November can always be a cold damp place to visit. To offset this and warm the cockles of your heart you should try the Threadneedles hotel! Based very close to the Royal Exchange in Threadneedle street the outgoing facade gives little impression of the quality hotel inside. Through the small doors the hotel opens up into a delightful foyer with the reception desk quietly located to one side. In front of this is an interesting lounge with quality furniture and a stained dome skylight above. There is plenty of comfy seating and free newspapers and magazines to keep everone happy. Off of this is a sizeable bar and onto Bonds restaurants where breakfast is held. Oposite the reception desk are two leather lined and quite classy lifts to all floors. The lifts open into a dim yet warmly lit corridor with rooms off in an initially quite complex pattern. We had a lovely sized room with a small lounge area, king size bed, good closets and a well proportioned bathroom with bath and shower. All of the room fitments were of good quality and worked perfectly. The view from the room was a little dissapointing being the stained glass dome above the lounge, however it was a minor point. The staff were all excellent and from check in to breakfast we couldn't fault them at all. We arrived at 10.15 am and they still managed to sort our room out even though we didn't expect it. Breakfast was again excellent and I have to say probably the best breakfast I have ever had! Bonds restaurant is a well designed room to eat it in too. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a quiet retreat from the hustle and bustle at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “City of London location, understated and classy.”
Reviews.Author: Leithal94
Reviews.Content: A lovely romantic weekend break. Away from the busy west end so if shopping is your thing it may not be the best location. There are plenty of shops still but not everything opens on Saturday. A short walk to the South Bank or St Pauls though. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest place we've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: UK_Yankee_17
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night with my husband to celebrate our anniversary, and we both agreed that it was the nicest hotel we've ever stayed in. From the moment we walked in the door we were made to feel welcome and at ease. Philip, the bellboy, showed us to our room and made sure we knew how to work everything and esp to find the kettle. We'd also booked into Bonds Restaurant for dinner, and we had a truely wonderful meal, again with excellent service. We slept very well - the bed was very comfy. There was a bath and shower available for use, and the bathroom was a very good size. We were impressed at the size of the room esp for London) and also appreciated the open space in the common areas of the hotel. If you want a great hotel experience, stay here! The staff are well trained, friendly and helpful, and their hospitality is second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Abi7734
Reviews.Content: I have just spent the weekend in London with my 6 year old and we stayed at Threadneedles, what a fantastic hotel! The staff were great, recommended somewhere to eat since the hotel's restaurant was closed and we also got a free upgrade to a suite! The breakfast was very nice and set us up for a day of sight-seeing, would deffinatly stay again, it's only a couple of minutes walk from Bank underground and although the area is quiet on a weekend it's just what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Cityfoodie82
Reviews.Content: I booked a room here for my wedding anniversary as a surprise for my husband. I informed the hotel it was our anniversary and they not only upgraded us to a suite but also put in the room a bottle of champagne, chocolates and silk Rose petals on the bed! Just lovely. All the staff were smily and very helpful. Nothing seemed too difficult for them. My only comment would be is that there wasn't sufficient lighting in the room. It was lovely and romantic when we arrived but whilst trying to get ready in the morning it proved difficult doing my make up. The best place would have been the bathroom but my husband was in there! Breakfast was yummy but be prepared for London prices. Wouldlione to go back and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Caroadnams
Reviews.Content: We booked one night's stay. The staff could not have been more attentive and welcoming and the room was beautiful. Great location. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, quiet weekend location in the City.”
Reviews.Author: Maddie B
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a weekend earlier in the year, absolutely beautiful room with enormous bed, great size bathroom, all the luxurious toiletries you would expect. Room promised an ipod dock, missing when I arrived but was swiftly purloined by the reception from a nearby room. Location is extremely quiet on a weekend (as was the hotel bar / restaurant), however, only a ten or so minute walk through the City and over the Bridge to the bustle of London Bridge and Borough High Street. The first hotel I've visited with an honesty bar; I hope it isn't abused by guests as it is a lovely touch. This could easily become a regular hotel for a treat weekend away from the world.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: MPT1974
Reviews.Content: Great hotel would seriously recommend to anyone wanting to stay here. Staff were friendly and helpful and polite. The GM Julian was really accommodating. We booked on 29 September stayed on 30th and 1 October great hotel will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Birthday Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Rosiern
Reviews.Content: The moment we walked into the Hotel Reception I knew that this was going to be a very special birthday surprise. The Hotel Staff were of the highest calibre and we could not have been made more welcome. The room was of the highest standard with a very comfortable bed and plenty of pillows. The list of 'whats on' provided in the bedroom was most helpful. Thank you also to the Hotel Porter in enquiring about my mystery birthday treat which was a trip to see 'South Pacific'. Highly recommended, next visit I'm definitely trying the 'Bath Menu'!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but wouldn`t stay there again in weekend”
Reviews.Author: THREOslo
Reviews.Content: Surprising good value for hotel in London - elegant, modern bathroom, nice location with proximity to St. Pauls ... but the area shuts completely down in the weekend. We were not prepared to see the 24-7 buzzing London completely quite on saturday morning, not to mention sunday. The streets were empty, all stores closed, no possibility for coffee and croissant unless you choose the full breakfast at the hotel. Particularly sad as the area seems to have lots of interesting coffee bars and stores.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AlisonKC
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend break with my best friend. Arrived at 12:00 on Saturday and as we were early for checkin took our bags no problem, checked us in ahead of room being ready and told us we had been upgraded to a suite. After shopping for the afternoon we returned to our lovely suite, Hilary Suite room 101, bags had been delivered to the room as promised. Lovely comfy bed, very roomy, good standard of accomodation, docking station for ipod and 3 tvs, including 1 in the bathroom! Staff were very efficient and welcoming. Room service was very good, we sampled a late night burger and chips and the night porter bought us an extra bucket of ice for the water we had been left with the turndown service.....a very cheery guy for 1am. Eggs Benedict in Bonds was the best we have ever had......and we have sampled a fair few on our girls weekend trips over the years! All round it was very enjoyable and we would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: RJB1000
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel last week and had the choise of staying at Threadneedles or the Hilton Tower Bridge. I work in the area and had dinner with a good friend that evening so thought I'd stay overnight in london. Threadneedles is slap bang in the city it is without a doubt the best located business hotel. It's definitely a business hotel rather than a tourist hotel and at the weekends the area effectively closes down so if your stay is bueiness this sia great choice if it's leisure then during the week it will be just ok but i'd rather stay elsewhere at the weekends. The lobby unlike most hotels has a serious wow factor the hotel is in a historic building and it is amazing. Although as in any historic building the restaurant and bar although very nice they are a little dark but overall this hotel is very good. The location of this hotel means you probably won't get any views from the bedroom windows and if you do it will be of an office building, however if your here on business that shouldn't be a problem although on leisure then it's alaways good to have some sort of view. The bedroom is very good with lovely bathroom with seperate shower, with good good toileteries and a tv for those who want one in the bathroom. The bed is particularly comfortable. The only minor challenge i would have is the tv in the bedroom is very small but today's standards it wasnt a problem for me as I went out that evening but I think i wouldn't be happy if I spend the evening watching it. It's probably half the size of tv''s in equivalent hotels. Overall this was a good stay and for the same cost as the Hilton Tower Bridge I'm glad I stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patchpup
Reviews.Content: Just can't praise this hotel enough. Stayed on business and found the staff exceptional and the room beautiful with fantastic large bathroom. Perfect location. The only downside was the very expensive breakfast that was not included in the almost Â£300 per night rate!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we have ever stayed at in London!!”
Reviews.Author: Regmyers
Reviews.Content: The staff were absolutely outstanding, faultless in every way!! We had such a great time. Luxury in every sense. Agne and Alice at reception were brilliant! Breakfast was a real treat too

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant in every possible way!”
Reviews.Author: Angharad81
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for a night on a weekend in London. We would say that this is the best place that we have ever stayed. It was truly first class. The service was outstanding and the room was perfect. The enormous bed was exceptionally comfortable - we both slept well in the luxurious eyption cotton sheets. The room was quiet and the right temperature for an uninterrupted night. The decor was stylish and the room was well equipped. Breakfast was amazing! We will definitely be returning again. Fantastic value.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best hotel we have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: john_whiteq
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Threadneedles recently to celebrate a very special anniversary. From the moment we arrived we were greeted by the Manager and staff like old friends, even though this was our first ( but not the last ! ) visit. We were taken up to our room, which was delightful, spotlessly clean, and immaculately presented, as was the bathroom. We asked for some tea which arrived promptly. Staff at reception took great pains to give us directions to all the local places of interest, which was much appreciated as we had not stayed in this area of London before. The building itself is magnificent, particularly the dome. We had breakfast in Bonds restaurant and it was a feast ! beautifully cooked and presented and well worth the money, cutlery and crockery are top class, as is the service. We were presented with a lovely gift on the day of our anniversay - thank you very much Julian for making our visit so very special. Threadneedles is a superb hotel, the building is special but it is the kindness, courtesy, and consideration of the management and staff that sets it apart. Our grateful and sincere thanks to you all.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've stayed at in London”
Reviews.Author: Louise W
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at Threadneedles on the 6th August. I had booked the hotel as part of his birthday surprise weekend away and when viewing the website initially had reservations that it may be more suited to business travellers rather than couples. On arrival however I was so glad that I had booked it. The building is beautiful and very close to Bank tube station which is brilliant. The staff were polite and friendly, and quickly checked us in informing us they had upgraded our room. The room was lovely, bathroom spotless, the bed was so comfortable and most importantly the room was quiet which is so hard to find in central London. I am a light sleeper and usually struggle to rest properly in London hotels with traffic and street noise. Also as part of the turn down service complimentary bottled water and a filled ice bucket are left out for you. We ordered breakfast in the room and although it is a little pricey it is worth it! I would not hesitate to stay in the hotel again and I will be recommending it to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely venue for a weekend away, peace and quiet but near enough to enjoy the bustle....”
Reviews.Author: Richard C
Reviews.Content: We booked the Threadneedles Hotel some time ago for our anniversary weekend, we had a weekend packed full of things to do in London (Field Day festival, good restaurants and museums) so only wanted somewhere nice to stay a little away from the hustle and bustle. Threadneedles provides this at the weekend, arrival at the understated entrance was a lovely surprise, two minutes walk from Bank tube station and very lovely inside with an amazing glass dome roof in reception. Excellent service on arrival, friendly and professional. A pet hate of mine is how much cash hotels hold on cards whilst you stay, my only complaint of Threadneedles was that they claimed to hold just Â£100 for room service, breakfast or the honesty bar, and yet they held over Â£250. But, most hotels do so I guess whats to complain about. The rooms was exceptional, a free upgrade to an executive, the good lady wife loved the cosmetics, I thought the TV in the bathroom was a nice touch! Business cards with your room address and direct dial number are a lovely touch for an "event" stay like this. The bed was huge, comfortable and so quiet. Excellent silent running air conditioning and a well stocked mini bar. Staff at all occasions, even on return from a field dancing all day at the Field Day festival were impeccable in their service and style. We will be staying again. Lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Again!”
Reviews.Author: SimonPainter
Reviews.Content: Another lovely weekend at Threadneedles, this time with an even better room. Service is formal but not forced, rooms are beautifully appointed and facilities are excellent. Can't really compliment this place highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel. Friendly Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Mrspjames
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay at London Threadneedles. We were made to feel welcome from the moment we arrived. Staff were friendly and very professional. The location is ideal, not too busy and not too secluded, easy walking distance to the tube. The room was lovely, very clean and also not tiny which is unlike most hotels in London! Worth every penny- will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL hotel, bit noisy though”
Reviews.Author: Fallon07
Reviews.Content: Treated to this by my boyfriend, a hotel that I have been eyeing up to stay in for the last 6 years or so... It is luxurious without too much fussing, staff are excellent without being overbearing, the rooms are pristine, the bathroom (we stayed in room 309), was bigger than the master bedroom at home, and has everything you'd expect of a top hotel - Korres toiletries, bathrobes and slippers and even a magazine rack... The bed was incredibly comfortable, with that so much coveted crumple of the crisp white sheets, and we had a lovely view out onto the Lloyds Building and the Gherkin. My one and only criticism is that there is little sound proofing between your hotel room and the halls... night and day I was convinced that my boyfriend was talking to me from the bathroom/bedroom when it was actually someone walking by... at times in felt as though they were IN the room with us... I don't know if this is a problem for all the rooms and the floors but it is the one thing that let the hotel down. I would also recommend anyone staying here to dine at their restaurant, Bonds, I have had a number of lunches and dinners at this establishment and have yet to be disappointed - fabulous food, wonderful wine.

Reviews.Title: “Loved London...Loved Threadneedles”
Reviews.Author: yoginimichele
Reviews.Content: Kind of tucked in the city centre in the London's business district, Threadneedles provides a spot of the old sparkled with modernity. I loved the fact this was an old bank converted into a hotel and I loved the view of a nearby church steeple from my window and the chiming bells that were never intrusive and rather lovely. I looked forward to my early morning wake up calls from the front desk....they were simply THAT pleasant. The staff was wonderful, the room very comfortable and I absolutely loved the bath tub with the complimentary bath salts. Elegant and comfortable, it was no problem staying in the city centre as there was a tube station in walking distance from the hotel. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, but a bit too formal”
Reviews.Author: xiv
Reviews.Content: I Stayed here one night in June because I like to be in this area (City), and all "my" hotels were fully booked. This was just a lovely hotel with everything nice and in order. Spotlessly clean, lovely bed, lovely bathroom with exclusive toiletries. Fresh fruits, water etc. The staff in the reception was extremely polite, and were standing up for me each time I passed. And when checking in and out they placed a chair for me to sit on. For me this felt a bit too much in away, but if you really enjoy being treated like a Queen, or have bad experiences with unpolite staff in other hotels, try this!! Very good location, close to Bank st, and 10 min walk to Liverpool Street Station

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lizz55
Reviews.Content: Threadneedles is a beautiful hotel located in the oldest part of London, the Square Mile. It is also just about 10 minutes walk to St Paul's and a further 10 minutes to the heart of Covent Garden, and from there you are right in the buzz. But don't be in too much of a rush to get to those areas that you miss the delights of this wonderful neighbourhood. Look closer as you pass those narrow alleys, there are inns and taverns in those darkly lit passage-ways that have been there since the great fire. Give one a try and get a history lesson with your beer. The hotel has everything the modern traveller needs and more besides. The breakfast will set you up for the day, the cocktails will soothe your tired feet and the beds are so comfortable that you will awake refreshed ready for another day's exploring. We have stayed in many 5 star hotels and Threadneedlse did not disappoint. We are already looking forward to our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot & Service”
Reviews.Author: cruzr412
Reviews.Content: The financial district slows down in the evening and weekends but overall great hotel. If you are looking for a location in the middle of the action of London this is not the best location. However, if you are looking for a hotel that you can take a short cab to the action this is it, so happy with the service here. Just well done!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheSomersetSmiths
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this great hotel for a weekend with friends, convenient location, friendly staff and quality service. The rooms were tastefully decorated and well equipped. Quality bar open to the public served fab cocktails, and breakfast was top quality. Would reccomend if staying on business in the city, or for a weekend away in the centre of London. Central line tube (Bank) only a few yards away.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: 45gpn
Reviews.Content: We stayed over a weekend and all shops and restaurants (even the hotel restaurant) were closed. Our room was small, airless, and dark. Hotel was so understaffed that our room was not made up until mid afternoon. Reception staff a bit pretentious. Alleged free WiFi did not work.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: ClaireBrighton
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a couple on a Saturday night. After much trawling through booking sites for a last minute break I eventually found Threadneedles. The price on offer for the weekend was very competitive (cheaper than anything else, even far more basic hotels), reflecting the position of the hotel in the city, which is very quiet at weekends. So you get a good deal but the fantastic service, facilities and room that would cost you three times as much during the week. The location is great - right near Bank station and walking distance to St Pauls and Spittlefields markets which both have a choice of restaurants, bars and shops. From the tube you can get anywhere, including London Bridge which gets you to Borough market, Tower Bridge etc. (which is what we did) and most of the rest of London through a variety of lines. The greeting at the hotel sets the scene for a fabulous stay. You are treated so well - this is how all hotels should do it. The room is furnished beautifully - we stayed in their luxury room which is the standard and this was spacious, massive bathroom, robes, great selection of toiletries etc. etc. We didn't go for breakfast as this was a little pricey, but I'm sure it would be a lovely experience and I might try it next time. I won't be looking for anywhere else to stay in London, we will be definitely be back. I can't recommend this highly enough. Try it!

Reviews.Title: “Rare degree of perfection”
Reviews.Author: CarosassoneCH
Reviews.Content: Really liked the style and the philosophy of the Threadneedles - including the customized business cards. The setting is very "British" - in the positive sense of the word. The lobby is a very cosy place and you can either work or meet nice people. Breakfast was very good. The rooms are nice, too, but a little bit dark and not as spacious as you may believe after entering the lobby. But they are equipped with everything you need, and the bathroom is also amazing (you can take two showers at a time ;-)). And I slept so well (in the heart of the City) that I forgot about the small size of the room. Prices can vary significantly depending on the date and the way you book - it's worth do do a little bit of research (or contact the hotel directly).

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more. Truly perfect.”
Reviews.Author: LeeB1983
Reviews.Content: This is my first ever review of anything but I feel compelled to share details of my wonderful experience at the magnificent Threadneedles hotel. We were fortunate enough to stay in the Terrace Suite, which (as its name suggests) has a marvellous terrace with a little glimpse of St Paul's in the background. From check in to check out, we were made to feel like royalty with staff immediately on hand and only too pleased to help at the drop of a hat. Room service was quick, excellent quality and good value compared to hotels in a similar price bracket and all the staff we met always wore a smile on their face. The whole ambience from the grand lobby to the little touches in the bathroom made for a magic setting. Considering it is in the heart of the bank area, we barely heard a sound throughout our stay and had one of the best night's sleep ever which is always a bonus. Whoever is responsible for their duvet/pillow purchasing has done a super job! We will forever remember this trip, not least as I proposed to my partner in the room. Fortunately she said yes and we shall definitely be returning to reminisce on this most special of occasions. I can only thank the staff for helping make the occasion so special and for their care and attention throughout.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mitrvls
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, good food, good stay nice quiet location..2 minutes to bank tube 10 minutes to covent garden in a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice London hotel”
Reviews.Author: jah123
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights. Nice hotel in an excellent location for meetings in the City. Even better for exploring the alleyways and old churches. Excellent service. I suggest the hotel make an arrangement with a nearby exercise gym for a reasonable fee (not 15 pounds!) Only amenity lacking in the hotel which will cause me to stay in other London hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay that has left us with wonderful memories of a special day.”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_Brien
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Threadneedles and held our wedding reception here on 20/05/11 and from start to finish we had the most amazing time. Right from the outset of the planning everything was made so easy for us by the incredibly attentive and welcoming staff and they did absolutely everything possible to make our day so special. All our guests commented on the wonderful wedding breakfast and evening food and the bar staff ensured that everyone's drinks remained topped up throughout the evening (a difficult feat with 130 guests to attend to). Great location, fantastic rooms...........without a doubt absolutely the best! Thank you to all the staff but in particular Nelio, Brian T, Brian, Barry & Julian. Sarah & Justin Waylen

Reviews.Title: “Ideal spot for a quiet, romantic weekend break”
Reviews.Author: WestMidsTravellers
Reviews.Content: This was our first ever weekend leisure trip to London (with a stop-over) and our choice of hotel proved to be an extremely satisfying experience. For those arriving by tube from Bank Station, take the Bank of England exit and follow Threadneedle Street on the right hand side to the junction with Finch Lane. An excellent Reception experience was provided by Romao whose genuinely friendly style was very welcome after a tiring journey. What a joy to be informed we were being upgraded - first time ever, anywhere - thank you, this was much appreciated. Our room was a great size with the famous glass dome virtually in touching distance of our window. Lots of lovely touches: a free large glass bottle of water each (would we like sparkling or still!!), a free morning newspaper, free tasty apples, free wi-fi, free tea and coffeee making facilities, a selection of lifestyle magazines conveniently placed in the bathroom. Of course these extras are all incorporated in the price but many hotels like to charge extra. The bed and pillows were wonderfuly comfy, we both had the best nights sleep in ages. Loved the 'Z on a rope', far more imaginative than the traditional cardoard Do Not Disturb sign. Our room (107) was equipped with 2 multi channel TVs (one in bedroom, one in bathroom), a good sized writing desk, plenty of wardrobe space (housing a brolly, iron and complimentary slippers) plus a couple of hard backed reading books for those of a less romantic nature! It is really hard to find fault, the only (minor points) to raise from a feeback perspective are: 1) one of the door ledges failed the finger wipe test 2) the ceiling in the shower was suffering from peeling paint - it looked as though it had been recently painted , issue probably due to excess condensation which might be remedied by improved ventilation Neither of these were a big deal, I would heartily recommend this hotel for service, location and comfort. For those on a budget, we had a magnificent English Breakfast, at the White Hart pub (corner of Bishopsgate and Liverpool St - 2 meals for a tenner).

Reviews.Title: “First class Service, as it should be”
Reviews.Author: David_H000
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Threadneedle hotel following a wedding I attended with my wife in the City of London. Being a very regular traveller, I had decided that I wanted to stay somewhere that was a bit more individual than the type of hotel that I normally stay in for work. I cannot praise the hotel enough for the level of service that we received during our stay. From the moment we checked in the service we received was highly professional and first rate. Our room was extremely comfortable and beautiful furnished. Breakfast whilst expensive for full English was pricey but delicious. Service once again was delivered with Style and professionalism. Overall a great stay and I would thoroughly recommend this hidden gem in the city .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - book it now!”
Reviews.Author: sintelliners
Reviews.Content: No negative comments other than it is quite difficult to find - just head for the Bank of England and it is behind to the left. Luxurious, quiet, clean and ideally situated for sight seeing. Would definitely recommend and book again. We are quite fussy so this is high praise for us as we never return to the same place. Check mini bar prices before you indulge!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of Calm for the Weekend Traveller”
Reviews.Author: deadyankee
Reviews.Content: During the week this hotel is at the heart of London's busiest banking district and the prices reflect that. On the weekend, however, prices tumble and the streets empty leaving you with the ideal base for enjoying London. The historic City Mile itself is fascinating and all within easy walking distance, plus you have Bank tube station on the doorstep which is available (almost) for your own exclusive use once the bankers depart on a Friday night. This was our second stay at the hotel and it won't be our last as it's the perfect place to stay when visiting the Theatre and the prices are very reasonable when considering the quality and ambience of the accommodation. This value is even more enhanced when one is fortunate enough to be upgraded to one of the hotel suites as we were on this occasion. The rooms are quiet and comfortable and the breakfast comes very highly recommended. In short, we currently wouldn't consider staying elsewhere when in London for a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in London”
Reviews.Author: PeterBean
Reviews.Content: 2 night stay in April 2011. After staying at the Glasshouse in Edinburgh (sister hotel) we decided to try Threadneedles in London. No complaints whatsoever. The hotel and service is reflected by the 5 star rating. The hotel is always very quiet and beautiful. The rooms aren't huge but aren't small (don't forgot which city you're in). We got a good deal so for us it was good value. if I had of paid full price I may have felt differently but when paying the price we did, no complaints whatsoever. The room was a little warm on a night but the excellent staff would I'm sure of been on hand 24 hours a day should it have bothered me. The room service was expensive and I imagine drinks in the var may have been too, but this will be normal for regular 5 star hotel guests. The location may seem 'a bit out of the way' in the financial district but the hotel is a 3 minute walk from Bank tube station which offers both the Central and Northern line so the links are excellent. Additionally it's only about 3 stops from Kings Cross. The best tip to give: Leave Bank station via EXIT 2 for the quickest way to the hotel straight up Threadneedle Street.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet comfort”
Reviews.Author: hubhopper
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the London Marathon and took a 'Marathon Package'. It was just what we wanted, a quiet night in a comfortable (Deluxe) room with a big bathroom and shower. The bed was large and comfortable and the monogramed bed linen added something to the sense of occasion. The city location at weekends is extremely quiet, which suited us, but with Bank station a two minute walk away there is easy access to the tube network and the DLR. Breakfast is an experience not to be missed, I tried the power breakfast and the full English (we did stay two nights!). Both really set you up for the day, I ran a Marathon on one and the other didn't need lunch. The staff are un-intrusive but there when you need them. Just one criticism, some small bit of maintenance are needed, a curtain pelmet end was missing, chrome was off of a tap, the sliding bathroom door wouldn't close fully leaving a gap of a few inches. Small in the scheme of things but when all else is so well done they do stand out.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShaneJones
Reviews.Content: I've had the pleasure of stopping at the Threadneedles hotel a number of times and it never fails to deliver. It really is a great 5* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Utterly amazing hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: sunlovers666
Reviews.Content: My husband and i decided to spend our 10th wedding anniversary at Threadneedles, as we had read splendid reviews on Tripadvisor, and we wanted somewhere really special, and i have to say that even though we have stayed in some fantastic hotels around the world, Threadneedles is the best hotel we have ever stayed in. It is a beautiful building, we were very fortunate to be upgraded to a suite, which was sumptious to say the least. Everything about this hotel says quality, the bed linen, the very quiet room, fantasic bed, it really is luxurious. The bar service and room service was very proffesional, yet friendly, and breakfast was definatley the best brekfast we have ever had in a hotel. Check in and out was also very smooth, this is a fantastic hotel, and now i would not want to stay anywhere else while in London, this is how a hotel experience should be.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Elegance in the heart of the City of London”
Reviews.Author: nancieo
Reviews.Content: A business trip brought my husband to London and I tagged along. We found this hotel by mapping it based on its proximity to an office where his meetings would be held. It turned out to be a fabulous location -- very quiet on the weekend -- and very close to the Tube (Bank) and within walking distance of London Bridge. If you are planning to stay at the hotel on the weekend, be aware that many businesses -- shops, restaurants, etc are closed. We did not find this to be a problem as it was easy enough to hop on the Tube and get to just about any other neighborhood in London. It was also a short walk across London Bridge to South London. You must get to Burrough Market which is open on Thursday, Friday and Saturday and very close to the hotel. The staff at the hotel was very friendly, attentive and helpful and the rooms were well-appointed and spotless. I wished our room had bigger windows, but other than that it was very comfortable. Only downside of the room was the somewhat noisy HVAC. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the City”
Reviews.Author: Nomadchef53
Reviews.Content: I chose Threadneedles for a weekend away with my husband after reading the great reviews on Tripadvisor. It did not disappoint. It is a beautiful building with the stained glass dome in reception dating back to its banking days as City Bank. The staff were not only incredibly friendly and helpful, but full of useful information to to make sure we made the best of our weekend away. Working in the hospitality business ourselves, we appreciate how important this is and it put the weekend on a positive footing from the beginning. Our room was comfortable and blissfully quiet, despite the violent demonstrations taking place only a mile away in the West End that day. I watched it all on the TV in the bathroom from my relaxing post-shop bath, as if it were in another country! The City is a great place to spend the weekend. Only a few minutes away near St Paul's there is a brand new shopping centre with great restaurants, including Jamie Oliver's new venture, Barbacoa and on Sunday morning there are the endless delights of Columbia Road, Brick Lane and Spitalfields to explore - all within walking distance! Breakfast was declared to be the best ever by my husband (and he is an expert!) and the bar makes a mean Champagne Cocktail! We cant wait to return - I have it all planned - Saturday morning strolling round Borough Market, lunch at Roast, siesta back at Threadneedles, dinner at Bonds in the Hotel and then down Brick Lane late on Sunday morning to graze on Salt Beef Sandwiches and take flowers and cupcakes back from Columbia Road for the week ahead!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous! Brilliant trip for my 30th birthday and Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: jemski81
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely amazing, the best hotel I've ever stayed in. It definitely deserves it's 5 star rating. The reception staff were welcoming and check in and check out is a breeze. We had a luxury room complete with desk and plenty of space. The bath was really comfortable and the addition of bath salts and TV were a nice touch. We had slippers, robes and a turndown service every evening. The bed was comfortable but the pillows were too squishy but that is just my personal preference. The hotel's restaurant is closed on weekends but they do offer room service. This hotel is in the City so don't expect much to be open on a weekend but Bank tube is 1 min walk from the hotel which gives you fast access to Covent Garden, Soho and Oxford Street. Visit Spitalfields Market it is amazing and we had the best meal at Wahaca restaurant in Soho.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with some small service mistakes”
Reviews.Author: Bon_Vivant_Stockholm
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Threadneedles over the past 7 months. I stayed in a Luxury double at the rate Â£150. Upon arrival I was asked if I wanted still or sparkling water at turndown and if I wanted a complimentary newspaper in the morning. I asked for sparkling and accepted the newspaper. When I arrived to my room and tried to log on to the free wireless internet, I noticed they had my name wrong (you need to fill in your name and room number for internet access). That was the first mistake. The second and third came when I received still water at turn down and no paper in the morning. Small mistakes, but with Threadneedles you expect the best... The room I had was spacious for one with very high ceiling creating a sense of space. The bathroom was very elegant with both a shower and a bathtub. There are several magazines provided for you to read. The bathroom has a tv which allowed me to watch some tv, while having a soak in the bath with the complimentary bathing salts and relaxing after my hectic day of business meetings. I loved my bed at Threadneedles and had a very good night's sleep without any disturbances at all. I slept like a princess! The location is great if you are planning to visit the City.

Reviews.Title: “Simply faultless. Beautiful hotel with exceptional customer service in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: mrsaddy001
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I visited this hotel, in conjunction with the England v France game at Twickenham on 26th Feb 2011. Given that it was to be a rare night away from the children and set to be a great weekend, I conducted plenty of research on the web, in order to choose a more central place to have a fantastic stay. The first thing I noticed was how highly rated and recommended Threadneedles Hotel was by previous reviews. I also noticed how each review had been responded to by the management of the hotel. Such a small gesture, but something that struck a chord with me, as being a personal touch that demonstrated interest and care. Having now had the pleasure of our stay, I can report back that every generous and highly rated review is well deserved. The hotel is beautiful and faultlessly maintained. Staff are (genuinely) friendly, courteous and helpful. Our stay was both peaceful and pleasant. Our sleep was uninterrupted. The room was very well appointed and comfortable. Whilst the windows are small and elevated (it is a historical building afterall) there was plenty of natural light and sufficient atmospheric and functional lighting in the room that it did not prove an issue at all. The location (for us) was just perfect. Just a couple of stops from Kings Cross and a very short stroll from the Bank Tube Station, which comes up right outside the stunning Royal Exchange building and right across from the equally impressive Bank of England building, which I believe is a museum. We explored the surroundings and found ourselves to be within a pleasant walk of the London Bridge and Tower of London. We found a nice walk along the Thames that took us right by the Tower and Tower Bridge. Shopping within the immediate vicinity of the hotel was closed on the Sunday, but plenty to be found within a few minutes walk (we found a great shopping centre near to St Paul's Cathedral - which is also within walking distance of the hotel). All in all, a fabulous hotel within a convenient and impressive location. Top marks.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was just lovely”
Reviews.Author: sagecoach
Reviews.Content: My son booked us in for the night of my special birthday, and we couldn't have chosen better ourselves. The details were what impressed us most - a lovely bathroom with 2nd TV and magazines, the mini bar offered a variety of drinks and snacks, and the Manager left a 'Congratulations' card. The location was quiet and the surrounding area worth exploring, and just a few minutes on the tube direct from Waterloo. Our breakfast was beautifully served and the staff made us feel very welcome. Thank you - we'll come again

Reviews.Title: “Central Bank location. Warm and modern. very quiet. restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: globaltraveler095
Reviews.Content: You can almost miss the entrance to the hotel, but it is worth finding it. It is one of the most quiet sleeps I have ever had. Not all rooms are huge, but they are well equiped. The lobby is one-of-a-kind---domed yet modern furniture fits right in. The restaurant is not for a quick lunch or dinner. The chef is remarkable. Threadneedles' staff are not stuffy, yet they are very polite ad helpful. This appears to be a large hotel, yet one rarely sees more that 4 other guests. It is quite welcoming. Very central to the "Bank" business district, and only 1/2 block away from the Central Bank's little-visited money museum. Proximity to Chinese restaurant and Gaucho's is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: Grunge_Spice
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed at the threadneedles with my daughter for two nights. The location is fantastic, the hotel is a 2 min walk to the underground. We were upgraded to a delux room which was a lively surprise! The staff were great and couldn't do enough for you. Many thanks for our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Jamescourtneyt
Reviews.Content: I've been working in the city since August last year staying on average 4 nights per week. I've tried as many hotels as I can in that time and also serviced apartments. So as you can imagine I've got a lot to compare this with. I'm the sort of person that will always manage to find some small issue to moan about, there's a real art to getting it right. It's not rocket science things like having an electric socket next to the bed to charge your phone overnight. Threadneedles seems to have thought of everything, even a nice little cupboard for the kettle. I liked having a tv in the bathroom too. Everything was finished to a very high standard, good room size, great sorbet from room service, complimentary shoe shine. There were a couple of small issues, I couldn't get the room warm enough and even after a call it didn't seem to improve. A call the following night sorted it out though. Didn't get a free rubber ducky I'm sure I read somewhere that there would be one. The pen in the room was to high quality to steal. And there were 2 gins on my bill I didn't have. All minor things though. Overall a great stay and I'll be looking to get back there asap.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: tootsie81
Reviews.Content: We stayed this weekend for 2 nights. We were shown to a beautiful room intially but which overlooked the air conditioning vents so asked to change. The staff responded with efficiency and politeness. Our second room was fitted to just such a high standard but we got very little sleep the first night due to the sash windows banging in the wind. We were therefore given a third room and upgraded to a suite. This was a stunning room and again fitted to a very high standard. Despite our problems the staff could not have been more helpful. They dealt with our situation with professionalism and friendliness. Nothing was too much trouble. This is the best hotel we have ever stayed in in London and we will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel in the City of London”
Reviews.Author: Graham_J0hn
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked this hotel for a weekend stay in London on a Lastminute.com deal. It still wasn't cheap, but for the quality of accomodation and service we got it was excellent value. Our room was a reasonable size for London, and the bathroom was very large in comparison. Both were furnished luxuriouly - the bed was extremely comfortable and bedding really soft and warm. The staff provided us with helpful, but unobtrusive service throughout our stay. The hotel is located in the City, which is not the best place for a weekend sightseeing trip to London. But we knew that before we booked, so we can't really complain. And all the other positive aspects of our stay far outweigh this slight negative.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel to spend an evening”
Reviews.Author: Diamondharry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Threadneedles Hotel just after Christmas. It was a great hotel, the room was very comfortable and the service was excellent. There are plenty of good restaurants near the hotel and over the weekends and holidays the surrounding area is peaceful and a far cry from the hustle and bustle of the week. After a hearty meal you can return to the hotel and enjoy a drink under the impressive domed ceiling. The rooms are luxurious and provide plenty of space. Ours contained everything we needed for a night 'up town' and a pleasant nights sleep. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for somewhere to stay in London and look forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: 0943cru
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Threadneedles for one night in January and right from the moment I walked in the door I was impressed. The staff were so helpful and friendly, which isn't always the case in a lot of places. I had the romance package and the room was stunning. The attention to detail in the room was nice and we were allowed to check in early. We didn't drink the champagne straight away, but the staff were happy to put fresh ice in the bucket for when we returned later that evening. I proposed to my girlfriend in the room, which made the stay even more special. It was the perfect setting for a private proposal. I have since had a nice email from a manager of the hotel congratulating us. I will be staying there again, my fiancÃ© and I are already planning to go back next year to celebrate our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it- will go again, great location for a weekend - the city sleeps, good food , great location.. Very nice people, not your”
Reviews.Author: Greenkingfish
Reviews.Content: Loved it- will go again, great location for a weekend - the city sleeps, good food , great location.. Very nice people, not your normal city hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location...Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkieab
Reviews.Content: I was able to go over to London for my first time with my boyfriend during the first week of January. We had looked at a lot of hotels to stay at, but chose this hotel because of the reviews here on TripAdvisor. I found the location of the hotel to be great. There was a tube station quite close, and we also took advantage of how close the hotel was to the London and Tower Bridge as we took the opportunity to walk across both of them. The rooms themselves were of a good size, but found the lighting in the room to be a bit of an issue. There was a burnt bulb in the bathroom, but the lighting in the room was quite dim in general, especially for getting ready. Michael, the manager who oversaw our stay was very helpful, and got maintenance to fix the light as well as bring in an extra light, which helped a little. Michael was very accommodating during our stay, and even gave us some directions, and restaurant/pub suggestions which we appreciated. Also within the room they had some fantastic magazines about London, which was neat, especially being a first time visitor to London. There were some great suggestions for sightseeing, eateries, events, etc. It was a nice touch. Also, during our stay I noticed that they had some really neat personalized touches within the room. You could order a movie and they would bring ice cream and popcorn for a small charge, as well as rose petals in the bathtub with champagne/cognac. I wish that my trip was longer so I could have enjoyed one of these! Contrary to other reviews of this hotels location, we found on the weekend that there was quite a bit of activity. By no means was it Piccadilly Circus, but it certainly wasn't so called "dead" as others have described it. Overall, it was a nice personalized hotel that I would recommend. If I were to return to London, I wouldn't hesitate to stay at Threadneedles again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gabriela C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 days and we loved (almost) every minute of it (except for when we had to pay for the mini-bar champagne). Lovely room, impeccable service, incredible breakfast. The only downside was a low WiFi signal. Bathroom is roomy and has some nice magazine for both him and her, beds very good and it's quiet. We were too tired too get out to look for a restaurant so instead we ordered room service (not fantastic, but very good quality food) and celebrate with the champagne in the mini bar. Location is also excellent, just a stone throw from St. Paul, buses and metro.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: campbell79
Reviews.Content: After a short walk from the nearest secure parking facility we arrived at Threadneedles and were greeted by very friendly and helpful staff. We had been invited to The Boat Show and were running late, however it was no trouble for reception to book us a taxi and stress its urgency. Our room had been upgraded and had a seperate lounge area. The bedroom and bathroom had been decorated with red petals and was a lovely touch. Breakfast was delicious and we were waited on attentively. We were given a map from reception in order that we could visit some sights and they were very helpful regarding different forms of transport. All staff were friendly and polite and said hello. We would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting London and hope to re-visit ourselves when we next decide to see London.

Reviews.Title: “beautifull hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: katie08Liverpool
Reviews.Content: arrived 27th december so we had a good deal anyway due to being a quiet period, we got there at 11am and could check into room straight away. Advised we were recieving a free upgrade to a suite at the top floor! On opening our room door we were pleasantly suprised to have french windows, patio and and big terrace / balcony with lovely views. It was a very nice touch. Room was not huge but big enough, big comfy bed, great shower and bath and 2 sinks. The staff there are very very helpfull and helped us on our last day leaving our bags in the hotel while we explored london before our late night train home.
