Location is just by Bank tube station with connections everywhere. It is very quiet as is in the financial district so would need to get tube/bus to most central places. I would really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely relaxing experience”
Reviews.Author: summerlea45
Reviews.Content: Had "won" this night buy purchasing it at a Charity Auction. Was a great experience. The City of London would not be everyone's obvious choice for a leisure break - but there is still an amazing part of the famous sights of London within easy walking distance. St Pauls, Mansion House, Tower of London plus the City itself - the financial hub - Leadenhall Market, Lombard Street, Lloyd's. As a Businessman making visits to the City this has to be a dream locsation (and a dream hotel) Service excellent, Rooms not that spacious but beautifully appointed. It has its own restaurant "Bonds" where the food is of a very high standard, with service to match - this was a Bank - the lobby lounge was the banking hall under a 19thC stained glaas ceiling - see the logos for Bank of the City of London. Enjoy - we did

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Queenie023
Reviews.Content: I was looking for somewhere to stay over Christmas in the City of London and found Threadneedles on Trip Advisor. On the recommendation of previous guests I took a chance and booked it - a decision I definitely do not regret. This hotel is a stylish, relaxing haven in the heart of the city. The staff were welcoming and attentive, the breakfast was excellent and the room (Executive Twin) was spacious and extremely comfortable (great beds!). The bathroom had a bath and seperate shower (something of a rarity in other hotels?), and the gift of fresh eggnog and chocolates were a lovely festive touch when we checked in. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is one of the finest I have ever stayed in throughout my international travels.”
Reviews.Author: allthecultures
Reviews.Content: There are certain qualities that I look for in a hotel - efficient, friendly service, high level of amenities, high degree of comfort in furnishings throughout the hotel and in particular the bedrooms, and both general cleanliness and newness of decorations and furnishings. Threadneedles delivers on all points. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our favourite hotel”
Reviews.Author: JulieB_9
Reviews.Content: This year saw us staying at Threadneedles for the 4th time; it's become an annual event to celebrate my husband's birthday. This year we were very kindly upgraded to a studio room which had all the things we enjoy about staying here - incredibly quiet, a huge bed, a TV in the bathroom, beautiful fabrics - plus a small seating area. The view from the window consisted of the dome of the lobby's ceiling and the tall office building next door but as it's a city centre hotel that exactly what I'd expect. This year we had breakfast in Bonds restaurant. The service, choice and food was excellent. The festive decorations in the lobby and restaurant are worth the trip, especially the huge red twig arrangement under the dome. The hotel enjoys a great location. At the weekend you virtually have the City to yourself and yet the West End is a short bus ride away, and the bus stop right outside the door. In previous years we've travelled into the West End to eat in the evening but this year we explored the new development in Cheapside which is a short walk from the hotel. It contains a number of restaurants with more planned and great views of St Paul's. I really hope we will be back next year the make it 5 years in a row.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not fantastic, considering the five star rating!”
Reviews.Author: Blackdog4
Reviews.Content: Good central location. From the street you'd never guess it was a hotel; but once inside the reception hall, with its fabulous dome ceiling, is very welcoming, and so are the staff. It feels comfortable, not sterile like so many big city hotels. That said, "Conde Nast Traveller ... top 50 hotels" - No I don't think so, this doesn't match many other decent four star hotels we've stayed in. It's good but not fantastic! On arrival we were told we had a room upgrade; I'm not sure what we had been previously assigned but the room we got was 'a little above' your average business room, but not outstanding. The view from the rooms; roof-tops, air-conditioning and office blocks. Service was quick and efficient, once your need was established; calling reception or room service on more than one occasion I had to repeat myself, in my native English, at least three times to gain a response "Ah, you mean..."? Uh, "Yes that was what I said the first time..." is in the least annoying and not what I expect from a hotel of this rating. Don't get me wrong I'm all for multi-lingual international staff, but this was painful..! It's at the pricey end for meals (Nice Restaurant, but Â£22 for English breakfast is steep) and room service, but overall generally good. However, they throw-in 12.5% service; which bumps it all up noticeably. Now sorry, but if I'm paying for a 5 star hotel I expect the highest level of service and will tip as I see fit... At the end of our stay the bill was wrong, items we hadn't used, items we had were not detailed... Quite amazing, but then I guess if its unclear what is being ordered, it hard to actually invoice it too! Would I stay again, yes - but I'd certainly look elsewhere first.

Reviews.Title: “One word - Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: SWimbush
Reviews.Content: Booked into Threadneedles taking advantage of their Romance package to celebrate my wife's birthday! First impressions - What's hidden behind these doors? Wow - a stunning lobby and atrium. Transport Links - Excellent. Bank Tube is a few minutes walk away and there's a bus stop right outside. Coming from the South Coast the hotel was a cinch to get to. Romance Package - Great fun and a really nice extra treat! Champagne was lovely and cold, chocolates were delicious (the small sample I got anyway). Room - Clean and simple lines with a wonderful bathroom - both bath and shower! Bed was so comfortable I didn't want to get up in the morning. Breakfast - Lovely to have it in the room - good choice available and delivered right on time. An honesty bar - in Central London? - absolutely. We were too tired to try it but having that as an option was great. Service - was made to feel welcome, nothing seemed to much trouble - everything was as booked! Purportedly the City's best cocktail in the adjoining Bonds - unfortunately I didn't find out about this until we were leaving on the Sunday night - a reason to return! Would I recommend the hotel? Definitely. Will I return? I hope so!

Reviews.Title: “Stunningly beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Donmat64
Reviews.Content: This s a lovely hotel in the financial district- this location may not be everybody's cup of tea, we thought we would try this area and were all pleasantly surprised. Very quiet at the weekends but within easy commute to many lovely restaurants and shopping. The staff were very attentive and helpful, the rooms not large but perfectly adequate, gorgeous bed linen and the breakfast was very tasty too!

Reviews.Title: “WOW, WOW, WOW”
Reviews.Author: Suze029
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this truely beautiful hotel. I could write a book on just how much myself and my husband along with my sister and her husband enjoyed our visit, but I'll save that for when I have an agent! tee hee. Once again from the moment we walked through the secret door, to the moment we left everything was beyond perfect. The staff are exceptionally helpful and want nothing more than to ensure your stay is memorable, the rooms are magnificent, stylish and worthy space in any world class hotel. (try the studios and the suites) Please, please give this hotel a try when you are visiting the city for something special. This hidden gem will amaze you with it's beautiful architecture and design and it's comfortable relaxing bar area not to mention the fabulous breakfast. We'd like to thank everyone who works at Threadneedles for a wonderful weekend, but special thanks to Brian, Ken and Ben. We will definately be returning again soon. x x

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, peaceful, city luxury”
Reviews.Author: georgeandmildred1975
Reviews.Content: It was a delight to stay at this hotel in the City of London. The weekend is extremely quiet but the hotel is so close to Bank station with direct and quick links to Canary Wharf and the shopping meccas of Bond, Regent and Oxford Street. The hotel restaurant was closed on the Sunday night so we took a cab to Tower Bridge, we walked back and how wonderful to explore the City in total peace and quiet. We found Dickensian alleyways and architecture that we have never seen before. The staff were delightful on arrival and the room was lovely and cosy. It had the most amzing Chinese puzzlebox of a cupboard with magic kettle, mini bar, plugs, iron all hidden away..very neat and tidy. The bathroom had an Asian influence with a separate shower and little details. The fire alarm went off during the night due to a guest smoking but it was dealt with quickly and efficiently. The bar is very well stocked with a great range of cocktails. All in all a wonderfully impressive building with lovely staff and great rooms. A good alternative to staying in the madness of the centre at the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely welcoming with exceptional service.”
Reviews.Author: Paulajones18
Reviews.Content: Threadneedles Hotel is beautiful. From arrival and check-in where the assistance offered by Ken was welcoming, easy and understated. Our suite was beautifully appointed with every whim catered for without fuss and in a barely noticed way. Further assistance was offered front-of-house, on several occasions, by Ben, who just couldn't do enough; once again in a discreet way. We will certainly visit again and further, will suggest the hotel to friends and colleagues for both business and pleasure use. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel - great weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: Worldplus55
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a weekend break in London. We decided to drive as there is parking made available at Tower 42 (very close to Hotel). What we had not realised was that with the Mayors show the weekend we visited the streets around the hotel were all closed and we could not get to the car park (this is not a regular occurance). The staff at the hotel, however, were excellent at helping us find somewhere else to park and were very apologetic - even though this was not their fault. As other reviews have said the staff and management are all excellent and were throughout our stay. A particular thank you to Brian for all his help. The room was then a treat. Much better than the very small rooms that you often get in London hotels. The lobby is fantastic. Breakfast is worth the reviews they have had and was stunning - though I ate too much!!! All in all a definte recommendation and I will be back whenever I head back to London.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: Vixster722
Reviews.Content: We have just returned back from an OUTSTANDING weekend at this hotel. From the moment we arrived the guy on reception (please excuse my ignorance, but he was of Chinese/Asian appearance, I didnâ€™t catch his name but wanted to mention him) was wonderful. So welcoming and friendly and interested in our visit â€“ he was a credit to the hotel throughout our stay. We were visiting for my boyfriend's surprise birthday treat and what a treat it was. I had booked the romance package (champagne, petals, bubble bath, breakfast in bed etc) and it was incredible. The hotel had upgraded us and the guy on reception wished my boyfriend happy birthday when we arrived (nice touch!) and there was a little card left for him from the management with our champersâ€¦. Anyway â€“ the roomâ€¦ we stayed in a studio and it was fab! The mini bar was the best I have seen and it was as though the hotel thought of everything with good magazines etc in the room. Gorgeous bath, I enjoyed my soak with champers and X Factor on the bathroom plasma, lovely. I would say the bedroom TV could do with being a bit bigger, but that is a minor point. The bed was huge and sooooo comfortable. My boyfriend had his shoes shined overnight, ready for our trip to Gordon Ramseys the following day. The hotel is quiet at the weekend which is lovely. The area around the hotel is DEAD! Nothing is open, but we expected that, so it was not a problem for us. You are so close to Bank that you can easily get anywhere. We enjoyed a lovely breakfast in bed (The New York breakfast and the Energy breakfast) and then begrudgingly left the hotel for check out, which was a quick and efficient as everything in the hotel. All in all, would I return? Yes! Would I recommend? Yes! Have I raved about it all morning at work? Yes!

Reviews.Title: “A little retreat in the city”
Reviews.Author: Iflylondon
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice for a romantic night away and both times have been impressed with the hotel and service. The lobby is beautiful and the rooms are comfy and have everything you need and more. I especially love the tv over the bath, great for relaxing in! Finally I must say the breakfast is the best I've ever had, every single thing on the plate was delicious, even the black pudding which I've never enjoyed previously. I travel for a living and spend around 50% of my week in hotels and I choose to come here for leisure so that is a testament to just how lovely it is.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: LizzieH46
Reviews.Content: Firstly I would like to say a big Thank You to Threadneeldes - this was our final celebration after a year of hectic travelling and celebrations to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. You took the time to look at our booking form and realise this and consequently upgraded us - thank you. Check in was excellent. Bags were removed from car and excellent directions where given as to where we would be able to park the car. Our room was spacious with every mod-con that you could ask - especially a TV in the bathroom. I am a total clean "freak" and after much examination the room was given the Liz H gold star for cleanliness. Unfortunately, my son is an Art Student with an extremely good "eye" for detail and did note a few strange "looks" in our room i.e. why have a couple of lovely pictures which are hidden by a bedside light and a further picture hidden by an upstanding light. These were mere incidentals and did nothing to detract for us from the room and the beautiful comfy bed with gorgeous bedlinen. The Bar served superb cocktails and nibbles. Our only concern was breakfast - didn't quite seem to get there act together. Need more than one hot water for tea between three of us and it would have been nice to have been asked if we would have liked a fresh tea bags and fresh water . The children had joined us for breakfast and although three "full english breakfasts" were ordered, no pastries would be available for at least half an hour - unfortunately, we had finished our breakfasts before the pastries were available. Actually, if i'm honest breakfast was very disappointing for Â£20.00 a head The location of the hotel- although not in the "heart" of things at the weekend - the location worked well for us with BANK tube station being just a three minute walk away. Would we go back - Yes Would we recommend - Yes

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: bog60
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice and quiet hotel, we stayed for 1 night during a weekend and wanted to stay more. Nice room, very comfortable and luxury bathroom, very clean. The tube is only couple of blocks away, buses are in front of the hotel. Overall for the price is a very good hotel Yes, we will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Five stars from the moment you walk through the door”
Reviews.Author: stridingedge
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and efficient staff greeted us the moment we entered the building. Bargain rate didn't alter the quality of the room or the service provided, Luxurious room and a very comfortable bed...and if you must watch Match of the Day why not do it whilst resting in your deep, hot bathtub! The location makes it very quiet at the weekend but with the Bank Tube Station very close by you are only a few stops from the major attractions. A few minor hiccups with the breakfast at Bonds's but not sufficient to spoil my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Rest, relaxation & room service - what more could you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: ralsop
Reviews.Content: My husband & I were attending a course at the Mermaid Centre which coincided with our anniversary so we decided to make a trip of it. Having heard of Threadneedles before (from a colleague who got raved about it) and after finding a good deal through LateRooms, I was excited to book a room! We arrived just after 5pm and I immediately understood why my colleague had like the place so much. The lobby is beautiful with a large domed glass ceiling but also a really homely feel (not sure how they meneged to achieve this as no expense has been spared on the glitz & glamour of the surroundings). We were pleased to be told we had been upgraded (probably because of our anniversary) and made our way up to our room. Because this hotel in in The City, it was pretty quiet & we didn't see another guest until the morning. Our plan was just to relax in the room as we'd been to St. Paul's on the way to the hotel & planned to go to Tate Modern the next day. And what a great room it was - huge super-king sized bed, lots of lovely pillows, dressing gown & slippers each, complimentary choclates & a well-stocked mini-bar. The bathroom was also fantastic & great water-pressure (odd thing to say perhaps but I love having time for a bath when I'm away from home & the tub filled up within a couple of minutes). We ordered some food from room service which was delivered promptly & was all delicious but especially liked the Threadneedles Club sandwich. Had a good read of the provided magazines & books, then fell into the best nights sleep I've had in ages. I don't know what the matress-topper was made of but I want one! Received our complimentary newspaper as planned the next morning & after a couple more hours lazing around we checked-out to go sight-seeing. Great Portugese chap on reception who was extremely efficient in processing our bill whilst simultaneously discussing various European footballers with my husband. We would have had breakfast at the hotel (it certainly sounded delicious) but we were keen to get to the Tate before the crowds. All in all, a relaxing, restful stay with a luxurious room in a convenient location - exactly what we wanted. Staff at check-in & check-out were excellent - warm & friendly yet efficient. Would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in the City”
Reviews.Author: Toomdc
Reviews.Content: I had a very good experience at Threadneedles. Check in was quick and efficient, the staff was very friendly and helpful. I had difficulty with the wi-fi and with the ethernet connection in the room I was assigned. The staff quickly addressed the problem and moved me to another room. I don't expect things to be perfect when I travel and I was very impressed at how quickly the staff addressed the difficulty I had in the first room. The location is great if you have appointments in the City as I did. It's not so great if you need to be in the West End or Knightsbridge, and it's pretty dead at night. It is, however, convenient to the Tube (Bank stop).

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: VJHPRT
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one night stay at Threadneedles Hotel (24th September) and cannot praise this establishment too highly. Excellent in every way. The staff were helpful and knowledgeable and made us feel most welcome - nothing seemed too much trouble. Went to a function at The Mansion House which was a 2 minute walk away. Our room (320) was perfect for us and we had a really good night's sleep. The hotel is also very close to Bank underground station and Liverpool Street Station. Breakfast was first class (though we noticed the staff serving were a little bit slow in taking orders for some of the guests). The welcoming emails sent before we arrived were most welcome and made us feel confident that we were actually expected and would be dealt with by an efficient team. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and shall definitely make every effort to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: devereux99
Reviews.Content: The Threadneedles is a great choice for either a weekend getaway or business. Its located in the financial district so during the week its perfect for work and to meet clients. Though at the weekend the city clears and it feels like you have london to yourselves! The hotel itself has an old world feel but still retains a modern interior. The reception staff are polite and will go out of there way to help. The rooms are well furnished, all come with complementary water, tea,coffee. The bathroom is great with a big tub and a flat screen T.V fixed to the wall. The girlfriend loved the soaps and bathrobe! The rooms come with an iron and everything you would expect from a hotel of this standard, oh the bed is really comfortable. Breakfast is good really good! There is a choice of continental or Full English if you do opt for the continental try the granola the best i have ever tasted! A lovely stay just wish it could have been longer than one night!

Reviews.Title: “Very poor”
Reviews.Author: Koo77
Reviews.Content: I am quite stunned that this hotel has such a high rating. I am in the room as I am writing this. There is very loud music being played from the bar. Asked my partner to ring down to see what time this would be finishing at, informed this would be at 2am. We were told they would ask for the music to be turned down. This has not happened. I am not a overly fussy person, but I expect to be able to sleep. I am now having to watch a poor movie to drown out the bar music. Yes the room is lovely, but right now I would trade that in for room where I can get some sleep. My other tip for those that choose to stay here is do not come in your car. There is no parking. We were aware of this and rang ahead today to enquire what was the best way to deal with this. We were told that we could park temporarily outside the hotel, that someone would be there to help with the cases, and tell us where to park the car. I assumed this meant that they have a door person on hand to assist. Not so. I got out of the car quickly with our two suitcases and had to drag them through the door. I then waited 15 minutes for my poor husband to park the car and walk all the way back. We got married yesterday. We are flying to the Maldives tomorrow and I thought this would be wonderful relaxing start. It is not, it's dire. There are superb five hotels in London, this is not one of them. I wish I had picked one of my tried and tested.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is nothing short of superb...”
Reviews.Author: BobbyPob
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing short of superb! The staff were very helpful, and made our anniversary very special! The rooms are the best I have ever seen, especially in London. All the reviews are spot on. LCD tvs in the room, bathroom, living room.,. iPod dock etc. It's old luxury with a modern twist. We found the location good as it's quiet, right next to bank station, but we took the car as you can park all weekend for free! Will be returning for sure.

Reviews.Title: “How could you want more in terms of service, surroundings and luxury!”
Reviews.Author: andbain
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped through the door we felt valued beyond all expectations. The manner in which we checked in was smooth and created a sense of quality. We were shown to our room and the facilities where explained. The room was large, clean, well equipped and nothing appeared to have not been thought of. The bathroom was the best of both worlds with a large bath and shower with some lovely showergels! We relaxed in the room playing music though the ipod dock! Cold bottled water was brought and we were asked if we needed anything more. Later we sat in the bar area and again the service was excellent and the mojitos went down very well! After a good nights sleep we ate the most amazing breakfast.. the term full english was so true as we didnt eat again till the evening! We cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: chzosso
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in this hotel. It's located in the business-district known as The City, so relatively quiet on weekends but still easily accessible via bus/subway/cabs. The rooms have excellent amenities as you would expect from a 5-star hotel. We did not take breakfast, so cannot comment on this but generally very satisfied with our stay. We initillay checked-in in room 14 on the mezzanine level but since the nearby street was a bit noisy, we asked if we could change. The staff first showed us another room in the same category but we were not sure about it, they even offered some earplugs if we decided to stay in our current room. Then 15 minutes later, they called us back and offered to move us to a very quiet suite room, at no extra cost, We were very pleased with this gesture and our overall stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service”
Reviews.Author: ashley1066
Reviews.Content: My wife and I usually stay at the Chesterfield in Mayfair but after reading the glowing reports on Tripadvisor, we decided to give Threadneedles Hotel a try. We booked for three nights and on arrival I have to admit were very pleased with our choice as the hotel was beautiful. Initially, the staff were friendly and we were pleased with the close proximity to Vertigo 42. Our problems began when on arriving back at 2:30pm on the second day to find that the rooms had not been serviced. At 4:00pm a note were pushed under the door saying they had tried to service the room and were unable to do so. We were instructed to contact the front desk if we would like our room servicing. We did, but and when we returned from a night out, we found the room only adequately serviced. No toilet roll had been replaced, water had not been left and the sink was unclean. There were also very few TV channels as all of the Sky channels were not working. I tried to so ignore the short comings and chose to try and enjoy the rest of the stay. It was the next day when we arrived back at 4:30pm from sightseeing to once again find the room not serviced and that we had run out of toilet paper that I really became dissatisfied with this hotel. We once again had to arrange our own servicing. This servicing, again, was very poor. Only one glass and one bottle of water was replaced. The TV was still not working so I called the front desk to be told that there was a problem (I knew this as I was the one calling them about it!) and that it would not be rectified until after the weekend. I did make my concerns known about the service we received and was given an apology and a promise they would investigate our complaints. I may be wrong, but in my opinion you pay extra for the right service. From other reviews this hotel seems to have been very good at doing â€˜that little bit extraâ€™ but in our case this was not so. We definitely will not be returning. I guess that will be the Chesterfield's gain!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in an Interesting Part of London”
Reviews.Author: TotoSurrey
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 3 night stay in this hotel. The staff are extremely polite and very attentive - when we checked in, all of the staff said hello to us and made us feel welcome. We didn't use many of their services as we were out and about most of the time. The building is lovely and in a very interesting part of London, not far from Liverpool Street station. The room itself was extremely clean and had lovely products in the bathroom - huge bath and good shower. They have a turndown service too and they bring 2 large bottles of water each night with an ice bucket. My only criticism of the hotel is that the walls may not be quite thick enough as there was a businessman staying in the room next to ours and we could hear him on the phone making conference calls. The walls do appear to be quite thin! Luckily he wasn't there for the whole of our stay or else we may have requested a change of room. Other than that, I could not fault our stay at Threadneedles and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fultonferry
Reviews.Content: There are some great aspects of this hotel but a few issues that if resolved would make it a brilliant hotel. The hotel is located in a beautiful and historic old bank building and both the common areas and the rooms live up to the photos on the hotel website. The hotel goes the extra mile regarding cleverness and added amenities, including magazines (Time Out London; In Style) and books in the room, popcorn delivery if watching an in-room movie, etc. The beautiful bathroom has a television, bath salts and other interesting products. Unlike a lot of high-style rooms, there is a lot of space and everything feels warm and friendly. The hotel is located in The City section of London. I knew going in the area would be deserted on the weekend but was ok with it given that I was spending most of my time outside of London. If that's not a problem for you then this hotel is well worth the money. However, be aware that restaurants and shops in the area are closed on Sunday, with the nearest open places being a short walk to St. Paul's, and the pace and service at the hotel are a lot slower on Sunday. There were a few other service problems and some attitude issues, but I found that it depended on who I was dealing with. Sometimes the service was spectacular, and sometimes a lot less so. On another note, I could on occasion hear the couple next door through the locked door between the rooms. I would recommend this hotel as long as the area is not a problem for you.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful building throughout!”
Reviews.Author: Annie25th
Reviews.Content: Everyhting you expect for this sort of hotel - excellent room, facilities, communal areas, restaurant, staff etc. We booked a special weekend package and had our bed and bathroom decorated with rose petals which was a nice touch. We stayed in room 15 which was perfect with the exception of the airconditioning being a little under-powered, but it had been 30 degrees outside!

Reviews.Title: “A great big WOW”
Reviews.Author: Suze029
Reviews.Content: A friend and I spent a girly night in London and I chose this hotel thanks to the reviews here on Tripadvisor. Threadneedles hotel is a true masterpiece of design and elegance, none of your typical overpriced over opulant 5 star London box rooms. Our room was extremely spacious and fitted with magnificently understated beauty and elegance. In addition to the hotel itself the staff are of the highest standard, being almost invisible until you need something, which they manage to acomplish so professionally and without any fuss but always with a smile. Room service was also amazing, every detail being absolutly perfect. I will be returning with my husband and friends very very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding night Bliss”
Reviews.Author: hedg1e
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our Wedding night. The Hotel isn't obvious from the outside the doors are small which belie how large teh entrance lounge and reception is. We could not see it at first and rang and the Nighttime reception who then waited outside which was a really nice touch. The hotel is wonderful, with an huge high ceiling in the entrance lounge, beautifully laid out, the room was frankly stunning the pictures on the website don't do it justice, with high ceilings and a super-kingsize bed. An LCD TV in the bathroom meant I could watch the World cup highlights whilst in the bath (just kidding this was my wedding night :) We had also asked for there chocolates and rose petals option which meant a bed covered in petals and a few wonderful patterns spread around the rooms. (nice choc's too :) Breakfast the next morning was great and the service fast.. I would definbately use this hotel again. The hotel had an 11:00AM check out but were happy to look after our bags until 3PM when our Lift arrived - which allowed us a few hours to walk down to tower bridge, st pauls and along the river.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: SimonPainter
Reviews.Content: Lovely attention to detail, great room and fantastic setting. Great for a weekend away because the City becomes a tranquil paradise once the bankers go home. Only niggle was that there was no smooth OJ available for breakfast, only the fresh stuff with bits in but that's hardly the end of the world.

Reviews.Title: “I struggle to find the words to describe just how brilliant this hotel was...”
Reviews.Author: Moonwalker-13
Reviews.Content: Brilliant Hotel, extremely helpful staff, offering suggestions without being pushy, especial thanks to Michael. The loby is cosy, the rooms large and comfortable, the location ideal for anyone who has meetings in the City. I honestly could not ask for more. Thank You!

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrew030
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. It is an elegant, old building on Theadneedle Street, just round from the Royal Exchange. It has a very old world feel to it, whilst having excellent service. The rooms were incredibly spacious and well appointed. I'm not sure they could be described as trendy or particularly contemporary - plush and traditional is probably a better description. I had breakfast in my room every morning. It was excellent - one of the best hotel breakfasts I can remember. I was always struck by the fact that it was delivered exactly on the dot. If you asked for breakfast at 7.30, it came exactly at 7.30. You could set your watch by it. The internet didn't work very reliably in my room which was unfortunate, but the business centre was good and allowed you to print from your own USB sticks which is not that common anymore (viruses). Location wise, the City is pretty dead at the weekends and late at night. Threadneedles also lacks a gym, which is a shame. I imagined I would find the location more irritating than I did - when I returned late from the office, I tended to walk into Shoreditch, which is really just around the corner, and which is much more active. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: bumble1234
Reviews.Content: What a terrible start to our weekend away!! My partner had booked through Lastminute.com and had booked a top secret room for Â£250, when the name came through as the Park Lane Hotel; of course I did some research on Trip Advisor, and was so disappointed when I found many terrible reviews!! I spent the whole of Friday calling back and forth to India (lastminute help desk) being told different stories each time!! Finally I was able to cancel and get a full refund. I decided to use Trip Advisor to book a nice place with great reviews, thatâ€™s how I stumbled upon The Threadneedle Hotel. I booked only a few hours before arriving and wow what service, even from the word go it was a delight. I had room and parking all arranged for me. Finding the hotel was a bit of a struggle, especially as I put the wrong postcode in to our tom-tom, so arriving at the hotel my partner and I were slightly stressed!! Stepping in to the hotel, just removed every bit of stress out of you, the staff were so happy, friendly and attentive. We were taken to our rooms, where every last bit of luggage was carried for us, stepping in to our room was bliss, it was beautiful, I canâ€™t explain how wonderful it was. The bed was huge, the lighting was just right; the bed had been pulled back, with big bottles of water beside our bed, bath robes and slippers. A huge bath and separate shower with Bath salts and lovely creams and shampoos etc. I was in heaven (this wasnâ€™t even a executive room!!!). Although we didnâ€™t use the restaurant we did have breakfast on the first morning of our stay which was amazing, the food was beautiful, with lovely bread and fresh juice. One thing I would say is that the breakfast and mini bar are expensive. The location is also fab, although it is in the city, the tube station is a 2 second walk and takes you right in to the west end!! On the morning of departure, I didnâ€™t want to leave. Everything was perfect and I couldnâ€™t complain about anything!!

Reviews.Title: “YOU WON'T WANT TO LEAVE”
Reviews.Author: yogiboo1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a birthday surprise and i must say I have never stayed in such a beautiful hotel. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful, nothing was too much trouble for them. As for the room......WOW! It was amazing, from the size of the bed right down to the bottles of water, slippers and personalised welcome card, every last detail was thought out and gave that personal welcoming touch. It is only a short walk to Bank underground station which makes it ideal for checking out the city. Didn't sample the restaurant due to already having a reservation elsewhere, but we'll certainly give it a go on our next visit. I cannot speak highly enough of this hotel, but i can say i will definately be staying there again, hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hidden Gem in the City!”
Reviews.Author: walthani
Reviews.Content: I booked Threadneedles as a suprise for my partners birthday and was very pleased with my decision... We were very impressed with the speedy service, security within the hotel, and how helpful all the staff were. I booked an Executive but on arrival got upgraded to a Studio and liked the spaciousness of the room and attention to detail, with the cards around the room offering movie packages and bathroom ones for him and her. The rooms were very clean and I honestly couldnt fault it in anyway. When we returned from our day out the staff had left a box of chocolates and a birthday card for my partner, the little touches are always so important. I definately would book this hotel again, fabulous with a homely feel!! Thank you for a brilliant weekend!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Hazehkm
Reviews.Content: I would normally stay at the Mandarin, but on this occasion decided to give the Threadneedles a try; I had a function to go to very nearby so the location was ideal and I'd read a lot of great reviews. I was actually really looking forward to trying out this hotel and really wanted to like it. The hotel itself is very nice; impressive to look at. Checking in was great, no problems there; I was asked what newspaper I would like in the morning and whether I wanted still or sparkling water with my turndown... nice touch I thought, however it turned out to be a bit pointless, but I'll get to that in a minute. About 10 minutes after I arrived, while I was trying to get changed, I had a member of staff rudely trying to barge into my room. I opened the door and the woman (without any apology or even an "excuse me") demanded to check the mini-bar in my room (were they expecting me to clear it out in 10 mins flat?!). I said I'd only just checked in... but she ignored me and just marched in anyway - checked to see that I hadn't emptied the bar contents into my suitcase (one can only assume!)... and left without a word. The bathroom was lovely - although I think they could use a better choice of complimentary toilettries... they didn't really go with the ambience of that kind of hotel, so they were a bit disappointing really. Other hotels of this level use Penhaligons or Jo Malone.... or similar. I had lunch in Bonds which I must admit, was fantastic! I would certainly eat there again and would recommend it. Upon my return from lunch I found a handwritten welcome note from the manager - which to be fair was a really nice touch, as were the personalised business cards. One thing that was very annoying was the fact that the hotel seems to cut off all service to your phone! A friend of mine in town couldn't reach me all afternoon because my phone had no service. The second I stepped out the hotel, I got a flood of texts and messages... bit late by then! I went out in the evening... and came back to my hotel room late to find there had been no turn down service and no bottle of water. In fact, no one had been near my room. Now, I don't want to be picky but if you're staying in a hotel of this calibre, you do expect certain standards of service, particularly when they ask you at check in about it. Anytime I've stayed at the Mandarin, whenever I've gone out at any time - be it for half an hour or several hours - when I've come back, someone has attended to my room and put out fresh water for me and things like that - and that's in addition to their excellent turn down service... so not to even get the basics at this hotel was really disappointing. In the morning - there was no newspaper delivered either. Again - a minor point but still disappointing. As I said, I wanted to like this hotel. I can see why people love it - as on many levels it is great. But the attention to detail on my trip was lacking and at at hotel like this, you expect the attention to detail to be superb. If I had another function to go to in the area I might give it a go again, but I'd expect them to raise their game. If you are a 5 star hotel in London - you have to live up to that - because the other 5 star establishments in London are going all out to deliver the best. I have indicated that I would recommend the hotel to a friend because it's not a BAD hotel; if you've got business or a function in the city then it's a great location and nicer than other options. As I say - I was just disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: vokese
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the Easter break, first time in this hotel. Having stayed in other top london hotels such as the grosvenor house we have to say this hotel is very impressive. Attentive staff but not intrusive, lovely decor and great attention to detail. The bottled water is a nice touch and very welcome after a day walking round london. The only problem we had with the hotel was room specific. our room was located next to a light box and we could hear it arcing all night long. I am sure we could have moved rooms but it was late at night and we just wanted to get to sleep! Other than that less than perfect sleep it was a great hotel and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended. A luxurious weekend escape.”
Reviews.Author: Guild4dGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel on Saturday as part of a mystery package from lastminute.com and I have to say, it may have been the best purchase I have ever made! Staff were warm, welcoming and ready to assist. The room was gorgeous, the beds a delight to sleep in and the additional touches of the handwritten welcome note, complimentary bottle of mineral water, bowl of fruit and note left on our pillow reminding us to put our clocks forward made the stay all the more special. This hotel is possibly the most luxurious and delightful hotel, in which I have ever had the pleasure of staying and we will most certainly be visiting here again when we next make an overnight trip to London. A highly recommended hotel and a big thank you for making our weekend away all the more pleasurable.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in the City - if you can afford it”
Reviews.Author: Hedgeman63
Reviews.Content: An Oasis of calm in the middle of the city, splendid service, splendid restaurant. A perfect boutique hotel, but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “5* service in the heart of the city - we'd stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: sportsfanHerts_UK
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay here for just one Friday night. When we got to our room there was a handwritten note welcoming us to the hotel & it was fun to get personalised business cards. The honesty bar in the lovely glass-domed lounge was a nice touch. It was also good that a nice big bottle of mineral water was delivered to our room in the evening. We weren't disturbed by any noise from the corridors or other rooms. All the staff that we met were really friendly and helpful. Great location for a 2 min stroll to Vertigo 42 for a glass of champagne with a 42nd floor view of the city (book in advance). Also just a 10-15min walk to Tate Modern, St Pauls or the Spitalfields area for mainly non-high street shops. We will stay here again when we get the opportunity for another London city break.

Reviews.Title: “ideal for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: Scott5297
Reviews.Content: the hotel is a few minutes walk from "Bank" underground station. on entering we were greeted with the pleasant odour of flowers and very polite reception staff. decor is very elegant and attractive. it is a very old building in the heart of the financial district of london. the room was on the second floor overlooking a quiet courtyard at the back. i had requested a quiet room and this was ideal - no noise outside at all. the room was crafted from an unusually shaped space. nevertheless, there was a nice bathroom with high-quality fittings and a walk-in shower/bath area and a well illuminated sink area with space to store toiletries. there was also a wardrobe area and a slightly small tv. overall i was very happy with the hotel as it was a comfortable place for a weekend break. the area surrounding the hotel was a bit dead as it was a weekend, though this was not a problem due to the proximity to the underground.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay, really pleased with our choice”
Reviews.Author: Shezza77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited London for a weekend, went to see a show and wanted a luxury hotel with great food. We were expecting a baby and it was to be our last weekend away "on our own" for a while! We searched for ages as to where to stay and in the end settled on Threadneedles. We got a good rate since it was a weekend and the hotel is in the business district. Its really central being steps from Bank tube but discreetly located in a townhouse facade. We had a very warm welcome on arrival from Romeo (who continued to give excellent customer service throughout our stay) and were checked in quickly. I had emailed in advance to ask that we have a quiet room on account of my pregnant status (no late night clubbing for us) and in fact they gave us a complimentary upgrade which is always a lovely touch. Our room was fab, huge comfy bed with quality linens, separate lounge area, sliding doors to large bathroom with big walk in shower, candles and arran aromatic toiletries. Decor is modern, lots of wardrobe space, minibar, ipod dock etc etc everything you would need. We dined out that night and later wished we hadn't since we had a mediocre meal in a local restaurant. The next morning our breakfast at THreadneedles was FABULOUS - probably the best hotel breakfast I have ever had - and if that is an indication of the restaurant standard then an evening meal must be recommended. The bar attached to the hotel is elegant and classy (though small) and we enjoyed several drinks in there. The hotel lobby has beautiful domed ceiling and is a pleasant place to read magazines/books it also has an honesty bar. We had a wonderful stay at this hotel and hope to return. Brian Tapson the hotel manager followed up with a personal email, and a few months later I contacted him by email to ask about a room for my brother and his wife who were caught up delays at Gatwick. He replied quickly and arranged a room for them - when they arrived their bedroom was "decorated" in rose petals and they were made to feel very welcome. Top service Brian! - thank you. A great central hotel with high standards. We cannot fault it in terms of a classy central location, particularly good for business travellers. Many thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Fab”
Reviews.Author: hartlepoolsausage
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend booked this hotel for my birthday treat and in turn I propsed to her (much to her surprise) I had booked champagne to be in the room on arrival and explained why. On arrival there was champagne, rose petals in the shape of a heart on the bed and in the bathroom! A very nice touch thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointingly poor”
Reviews.Author: Simonjep
Reviews.Content: Too many reasons to mention them all but a few are poor serivce, very poor breakfast. Noisey room, woken up at 4am by the sound of another rooms plumbing. Not what you would expect from a place like this.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding quality, sublime service”
Reviews.Author: TripperGal
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a bit of a splurge over the holidays - and this was it. From the moment we checked in, to the moment we left, we felt as it we'd stepped into another world. Well trained, gracious and helpful European staff who were actually pleased to look after you. Stunning hotel space in a reworked bank building, in the heart of the financial district (no issues with noise at night here). Steps away from the Bank tube stop, elegent top-drawer shops, and only a short walk to the River Thames. Though we did not dine at their signature restaurant, we did order up a nosh plate for a late lunch after checking in - lovely arrangement of meats and treats and a very fine wine. And New Year's Day breakfast (didn't feel like walking about to find something) - while a bit pricey - was just a lovely way to start a lazy day. The room was well appointed with a range of amenities that gave it a spa-like quality. We weren't there to spend a lot of time in the hotel, as we were trouping and tubing all over London - but when we did come back at day's end, it was like a small oasis. Best afternoon naps. Ever. A hotel to remember. And to come back to.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice But Pricey”
Reviews.Author: MBones7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business, was the only hotel with available rooms in the City. I stay in the City a couple of times per year and this is clearly superior in every way over the usual suspects. But its not cheap, and I'm not sure it's worth the difference, particularly if you are staying multiple nights. Beautiful lobby, friendly and professional staff, and nice rooms. Good location if you have business in the City, and restaurant is very good for breakfast. One downside - no on site fitness center, you need to go to a health club around the block.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: GlamorousGirly
Reviews.Content: The staff couldn't do enough for us. It was a very pleasurable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: occasionaltraveller6
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel. We went as a special treat and it's rather more upmarket than we're used to (most of the other people staying there looked like bankers) but the staff were lovely to us, even offering to look after our scruffy rucksacks the day after our stay. The room was a good size, quiet, comfortable and attractive. It had the best mini bar I've ever seen, with a good choice of gins! We didn't eat dinner there, but, based on the quality of the breakfast, I'd expect it to be good. We also found the location very convenient for walking round the centre of London and found plenty of nice little shops and cafes nearby. It's not cheap, but definitely a good choice for a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury room at a good price for a fun city weekend”
Reviews.Author: Agent9
Reviews.Content: I experienced this hotel over a weekend so I don't think it is representative of what it is like on the weekday when there are lots of business travelers. The room was a little dark but very cool and comfortable and I loved the bath products. I didn't use many of the many ammenities that the hotel has to offer but they were all available.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: ChirpyTurkey
Reviews.Content: This is an impeccably kept hotel, with some great features in the building. It's in the business district so you will get better rates at the weekend and it's close enough to the major attractions to still be convenient. Only downside, the restuarant is closed at weekends (but very good alternatives recommended). Katrina was great about making our wedding anniversary special - thank you. Great package to upgrade (champagne, chocs, rose petals etc.); recommend this if you are planning something special. Generally the service was without fault, everything was exceptionally well attended to and timed; including room service breakfast ordered for 9:45 and delivered at 9:45 exactly! Perfect service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Really Helpful Staff - Stunning Room - Top Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SteveR71
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife as a birthday treat for her. We were given a double upgrade to a suite which was amazing. Staff had put a card and chocolates in the room with petals on the bed......made to feel very special!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Nerak_of_Soo
Reviews.Content: Spending the night at this hotel was one of the best decisions me and my husband have made. The only problem we had was finding the hotel, the exterior is quite discreet. The service upon arrival was very welcoming and the room was bigger then expected. The view wasn't great, but didn't spoil the night. Having room service available 24 hours came in handy when we were able to order dinner at 11pm. We didn't get the chance to make use of the bar or restaurant while we were there, so we'll have to book for longer next time!

Reviews.Title: “A small paradise within the Banking District of London”
Reviews.Author: Daydreamerlibra
Reviews.Content: I simply adore this place since the first time I have had the pleasure of staying in London. It is the only hotel I have ever cared to rest my head in when I am there. Thank you Threadneedles for creating a cozy enviroment for me and my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with some really nice touches”
Reviews.Author: Stainey
Reviews.Content: I met my wife here on a Saturday for a one night stay after she'd been to a conference in the city and I was able to leave the kids with the grand parents. Although slightly tricky to find by car on this particular weekend (mainly as the road was closed for construction work on a building up the road) it's ideally suited for the tube which is yards down the road from Bank station. At weekends this part of the city is dead (even the hotel restaurant is shut) so you need to get the tube for food or shopping but it's all just a short ride away and not a big deal for us. The reception area is beautifully appointed and all you could hope for in a five star. There is an honesty bar around the central area (well stocked and a really nice touch) with sofas, chairs and tables and complementary magazines with a beautiful stained glass domed ceiling which is very impressive. The hotel bar is equally well appointed with contemporary furniture and moody lighting and I can definitely recommend the cocktails. The rooms are well sized with more contemporary furniture and an excellent bathroom including a TV you can watch whilst in the bath - nice! There are tea and coffee making facilities which I always like as some of the other five stars I've stayed in expect you to order room service very time you want a hot drink. Breakfast was taken in Bonds the attached restaurant which really is a great space. Huge ceilings and great architecture match the award winning breakfast which offers huge choice and generous portions (always important on a Sunday morning). The service throughout the stay was very good and I'd be happy to stay there again. We got a good late deal on lastminute.com but I think if I'd have paid the full price I'd have felt short changed. The main reason being there was no spa, gym or swimming pool which I would have definitely used if there had been one but you can get room treatments if you fancy a massage. There is a Virgin gym around the corner which we could have used and surprised they don't offer a day membership through the hotel or at least mention it on booking in. On the whole really enjoyed the stay and will definitely consider staying again if a good deal comes up again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: londonberry
Reviews.Content: We ended up getting a romantic package for the weekend. They managed to upgrade our room from an executive to a suite. It was absolutely amazing! The rooms are lush and the breakfast was amazing. They had classical music on the radio when we walked in!

Reviews.Title: “Great gem in the city”
Reviews.Author: Meredith_Montgomery
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Threadneedles twice now and each occasion had a really great stay. Attentive staff, good size rooms and amenities. The bed was large and comfortable pillows and duvets. Also, the housekeeping staff had noticed that it was our anniversary, and rose petalled the whole room and bathroom when we returned. Only downside is of course it's in the centre of the city so, bars/restaurants need to be thought about in advance as at a weekend the environ is dead. Saying that the hotel does do a great range in cocktails, and your not far from getting to places.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: LolaHot
Reviews.Content: We booked hotel for our anniversary as part of a package to see Sister Act. Friendly and attentive staff, attention to detail in the room is excellent. Had wanted to eat in the restaurant but couldn't as we wouldn't have made it across London for the show as the restaurant didn't open until 6pm, which surprised us. Comfortable bed, great toiletries, excellent bathroom. My husband enjoys his food said it was the best breakfast he'd ever had. Fantastic domed ceiling in reception. Just loved it all. To make it truly exceptional at weekends when the hotel isn't as busy a 12 O'clock check out should be the norm. 11am on a romantic break is a bit early especially as housekeeping knocked at 11.01am and asked us how long we'd be! If they could start serving dinner at 5.30pm for pre-theatre and later check-outs they'd be onto a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: muchtravelledAussie
Reviews.Content: I recently spent the weekend in London en route back to Australia while my husband was still travelling. Because of its location in the City of London financial district, Threadneedles offers very competitive weekend rates and its proximity to the Tube, buses, etc . make it convenient for shopping and other attractions. The staff were efficient, courteous and helpful and the room very comfortable, modern and spacious, particularly by London standards. While the attached restaurant is closed on the weekends, the room service was very good (breakfast was excellent) and promptly delivered. A most pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Abhorrent Service at an Otherwise Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: louisachilds
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel has great rooms and is very well-located for the business traveller with meetings in the City. But, for such a nice hotel, the service is inexcuseably awful. The concierge has no knowledge of the area and can't recommend lunch or dinner places on weekends or at night. Room service orders are botched. Laundry sent out only comes back on time when you threaten not to pay. Wake-up calls come late. (A wake-up call set for 6 am came at 6:30, and the called said, "Whoopsie! Are you awake?") Cars ordered do not arrive. The housekeeping staff is overly aggressive and intrusive. I would recommend this hotel only (a) if you're stuck in the city; and (b) if the Andaz or Apex is booked! This could be a great hotel, but management needs to pull it together.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended! 5 stars at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Canada_is_Home123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Threadneedles for three nights before going to Portugal. It was a great hotel - I have nothing bad to say about the facility. The lobby is beautiful, our room was spotless, spacious, and the bathroom was gorgeous. A beautiful large shower and soaker tub! The only complaint we had was that the men at the front desk were "decorative, not functional". They all looked like GQ models, however; they didn't seem to know the city and could not answer any of our basic questions! Thankfully we had done our research and didn't really need their help. The hotel is located in the middle of the financial district so on weekends it is a ghost town. However, because of it's non-touristy location, you can find some great prices online (we got our third night free!). The tube is right across the street and we were able to take the tube from the airport directly to the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Top boutique hotel, excellent value at week-ends”
Reviews.Author: MarkandCat
Reviews.Content: We managed to get a very good deal here including an updgrade to a suite (Hilary) and the deal was excellent value for money. As others have stated this part of London (City) is dead at week-ends hence the very good rates. Also this means that the hotel restaurant (Bonds) is closed so you need to find somewhere else to eat, however this isn't a problem as number of nice places to eat nearby - Spitalfields is a short stroll away on a nice evening (I actually love the City when it's quiet) or a short hop in a taxi. The bar is still open at week-ends, stunning to look at but might be pretty empty, good for a cocktail before you head out and serves amazing Mojito's (although not cheap and if you charge to your room a 12.5% service will be added automatically). Spitafields market is also well worth a visit on a Sunday when all the stalls are open. Overall a beautiful hotel and a great experience - perfect for a romantic break, stunning design, v.comfortable beds, and one of the best full English breakfasts anywhere (although service at breakfast was a bit hit or miss).

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but better value elsewhere?”
Reviews.Author: TrFiVi
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay here. Couple of small negative points. Booked a double room which ended up being two twins shoved together with a noticeable bump down the middle - not ideal for a romantic night! Also (as I note another reviewer here noted) they needed two phone calls to respond to requests, when surely one should suffice at a hotel of this class. Morning paper missing too. I know these can seem like small grumbles, but when you pay for a hotel of this class you expect these basic things to work seamlessly. I left comparing this to my stay at the Cavendish which I loved and where I felt service was better. I know which one I will be staying at next time.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comfortable, quiet and amazing value”
Reviews.Author: ClarissaLondon
Reviews.Content: Got a late booking and so a great deal, and we were upgraded as well. Living locally and knowing London very well we really appreciate the location and the comparatively high standards. Lobby which is old bank HQ - huge and beautiful space topped by stained glass dome. Great first impression. Room was directly on Threadneedle street but very quiet on a Saturday night, and probably midweek because of the double glazing. Service was friendly, efficient and refreshingly discrete. Bed was delightfully comfortable and bathroom extremely good. Room much better than a Marriot and we feel better than the Four Seasons Canary Wharf which is old tattty and overpriced. Parking may need to be NCPmidweek but not so at weekends where there are spaces to be found nearby in city side streets. In summary an extremely good night, slept deeply in great comfort, and so excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: Phillydunkin
Reviews.Content: Threadneedles is centrally located in The City of London in an historic building that has been elegantly updated while being very mindful of it's history. The entire staff is very knowledgable, and attentive to details. Thanks for an enjoyable stay away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: pinkvintagerose
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Threadneedles Hotel in June with my partner on a weekend break. Hotel was very close to Bank of England & 2 - 3 mintue walk to Bank tube station. As other reviewers have mentioned there is not alot of shops or resturants ect but with the tube being so close & Tower Bridge & Liverpool Street Station within walking distance you will find something. The hotel itself is lovely, beautiful dome ceiling in the lobby & the honestly bar is a wonderful idea (as long everyone is honest & doesnt put your room number down insted of theres!) We opted for the Breakfast in bed and were not disapointed. Fresh Fruit, Toast, Jams, Full English Breakfast & Muffins were delicious. We stayed in an executive room of which we were upgraded from a double deluxe, bed was very comfortable & the bottle of water upon turn down was lovely idea. The bathroom was quite big & had a tv in it, which is a fab idea if you want to sit in the huge bath and watch tv at the same time! The little rubber duck which reads 'please take me home' it a nice touch. I would recommend this hotel to anyone - its clean & the staff are always friendly & you always get your breakfast on time! Result. Well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “really good”
Reviews.Author: changingrooms
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for one night as we had an engagement to attend in the city that evening and decided to stay nearby. The hotel was very good and I thought the rooms were designed very well. Nice touches like bottles of water at turn down and even the newspaper had it's own bag! There was a TV in the bathroom and the toiletries were very nice and plentiful. We also had a good breakfast with very good service. The bed was very comfortable too. Overall really good.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: USTnick
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful, the staff was very helpful, and the bartenders at Bonds were very accommodating, if not particularly social. The location was conveniently a short walk of three blocks away from my office, but, being in the City of London, the area was decidedly dead on the nights and weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a special occasion”
Reviews.Author: OxfordAardvark
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight on their "romantic package" - special weekend deal for a hotel that is aimed primarily at the business user during the week. Champagne and chocolates in room, flower petals on bed etc - all exactly as promised. Located almost next door to the Bank of England - not the usual spot for a leisure hotel, and very understated from the outside, so much so that you don't realise it's a hotel at all. Once inside it's luxury throughout, with excellent service. The lobby has a massive stained glass dome, where you can sit and gaze upwards, whilst using their honesty bar. Rooms excellent (although we did get a free upgrade to an executive suite, so they may not all be quite as big). Well located for attractions such as Tower of London, although at weekend restuarants can be hard to come by in the vicinity. Try Northbank on the Thames by the Millenium Bridge.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS HOTEL- NEEDS TO WORK ON THE SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: CaymanFoodie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night for a wedding that was next door. When we phoned to ask about an extra bed for our daughter no mention of a charge was made, we phoned twice. Both times we were told as long as we booked a bigger room we could have a cot. When we arrived we were asked if we wanted twin beds, we said no we requested a king bed and a roll away cot for the child. We were told it would be and extra 50 pounds! We were taken to our room, and it had twin beds. We were in a hurry to get to the wedding so were willing to make do! We then got a phone call apologizing for the mix up and they would move us to the room next door which was the room we had booked and paid for, and they would give us the bed at no charge for our inconvenience! When we went to check out the next morning.. we were told we had to pay 50 pounds for the bed! We explained to the woman what had transpired the previous day.. she just kept saying NO! As if it was not what had happened??? We finally spoke to the manager, who made it obvious he did not believe us but he was going to waive the charge! We left with a bad impression of the hotel though it was absolutely gorgeous and wonderfully appointed!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: jamiltaha
Reviews.Content: The hotel was simply great, from the moment you enter the lobby until you you reach your room; you are simply pampered all the way. A new bottle of water on daily basis, the cleanest sheets ever and bathroom. The guidance and tips the reception staff offered me as a tourist in London was great and to the point and actually they allowed me to save money in relation to transportation fees and which way to take to reach my destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Wow. I don't want to go 3* again!”
Reviews.Author: ASecretSquirrel
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night, and booked the hotel on Friday for Friday, my original hotel booking at another hotel had falled through. The location for the hotel is fantastic - right in the centre of the city within 2m walk of bank and within a 10m bus ride of the value and nice restaurants of the east end - think Indian food. It's also a place where you can get to Oxford Street by tube or bus withtout a problem. The hotel itself; I was totally blown away by the quality of the decor and the furnishings. I had a double room - which my invoice has marked as "LUX" (which I'm assuming was luxury) but I think I was booking 'standard'. Perhaps it was a free upgrade - who knows. The room looked like it belonged in an upmarket house and didn't look like a hotel room at all. The things that stood out for me in the hotel were a. The bed linen was all fresh and high quality. THere was none of this white sheet that you usually get between you and the actual duvet (a short cut for hotel staff to keep their covers cleaner for longer). The bed was super comfortable - I had a backache that had persisted for a week, but the bed let me drift off within minutes of trying to sleep. b. We left the room for 1hour to get something to eat, and even though we'd messed the bed up just unpacking - housekeeping had come in and retidyied it!!! I was so blown away. And they left complimentary sparkling water and still water too. c. The toiletries were just lovely and great becuase we got a chance to freshen up before we left the hotel and there was enough for 2 - 3 showers without needing a replacement. d. The ambience of the room was lovely and there was a plasma tv in the shower (which incidentally was marble throughout). All in all, I can't find fault with the hotel and for the price I paid, I can't believe how fantastic it was. I may never stay there again, but only because I like to get a broad experience of hotels - and that means trying other hotels instead. However, if I was a frequent visitor to London, I would definitely stay there, and I have a feeling, that I was lucky to have lost my first choice hotel. I will treasure the memory of that day for a long time to come.

Reviews.Title: “Jewel of a property in heart of financial district”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaFamilyof5
Reviews.Content: Threadneedles is truly a gem. Stayed for four nights on a recent business trip and could not have been more pleased. The staff was as helpful and attentive as any I have encountered anywhere. The rooms are well appointed and very private. An ideal location for our business in the financial district. Convenient by underground and walking to anywhere you need to go in London. St. Paul's Cathedral was an easy 10 minute walk, and the Bank tube station is a two minute stroll. The beds were incredibly comfortable and the bathroom was fantastic - marble, wonderful shower, great toiletries, etc. Shopping at nearby London Exchange is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: HisFussiness
Reviews.Content: This hotel is smack in the middle of the city financial district so at weekends 1) in the absence of city slickers they offer good rates and (2) this historical area is blissfully peaceful. Two minutes from Bank tube station it really is a calm oasis from the bustle of the west end. Very few shops and restaurants open at weekends but nearby Liverpool Street station environs offer a bit of both. Nice, smallish double room, immaculately clean. Returning to my room one evening I interrupted the turndown service (which I am not a fan of). I mentioned this on a feedback form and the next day I received an e-mail apologising. I think this is the type of hotel that would note your preferences on their system to ensure your next visit is just how you like it. In summary I would totally and utterly recommend this hotel at weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Martyn_Megan
Reviews.Content: I cannot speak more highly of this boutique hotel, in fact I would go as far as to say its the best hotel I have stayed in throughout the UK. From the moment you walk in the discreet entrance next to Bonds restaurant, through to the the gloriously decorated foyer with its fabulous dome you leave London behind and enter a haven of charm and peace. Their attention to detail was outstanding, from the reception desk to the immensely polite and professional staff to the fantastic touches in the rooms. The personal business cards, the bath salts and rubber duck in the bathroom, the individual him and her menus for bath times, the ipod dock, the welcomed turn down service, the dangerously soft bed, the delicious power breakfast, all led to an experience worth every penny and one I cannot wait to repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic bargain for a weekend in The City”
Reviews.Author: wickedwaterwitch
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel and my husband and I had a fantastic weekend break here earlier this year. The old banking hall is gorgeous, the rooms are luxurious and the service was excellent both times I stayed. (I had stayed on my own the previous weekend as I was having dinner with friends in London). There are also nice touches like cards suggesting a biscoti and brandy and offers of movies and popcorn in your room. The studio rooms are nicer than the suites in my view (I looked around both), as the studios are lovely large rooms, wheras the suites I looked at had 1 normal sized room with another normal sized room off it. Very kindly they upgraded us and very unusually, I asked to be downgraded back to a studio from a suite. They were very patient while I decided which to have too. At Â£225 + VAT for a studio on a Friday and Saturday night this was a luxurious bargain. We booked direct with the hotel. Service was attentive, fast, smooth and they didn't bat an eyelid when I phoned at 4pm and said I'd forgotten a comb and could they please buy one and leave it in my room for when I arrived at 5.30. I also love the small Threadneedles business cards showing your direct room number, very cool. As is the honesty bar. I'd stay here again, anytime, really liked it a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and friendly”
Reviews.Author: KJHONGKONG
Reviews.Content: Stayed for just one night. The room was lovely and the bathroom very warm and spacious. Staff were friendly and helpful. The only disapointment was room service. The food arrived under cooked and although a new order was supposed to be on the way it never arrived. Not to worry, the bed was very comfortable and room service breakfast excellent. I would definitely stay here again for the location and warm feeling of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “100% Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Warwick1971
Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel, great price, brilliant staff, great location . I promise I dont work for them. Stayed a Friday night for my wifes birthday and it was perfect. Bank tube is a few minutes walk away which means London is very accessible. Compared with other hotels of this calibre in London you are paying about 50% less, though I do believe during the week rates are higher. Must not forget the breakfast which was very good .

Reviews.Title: “A Memorable Evening”
Reviews.Author: lumpella
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as part of a surprise 40th birthday present for my fiance. We were not disappointed as it is lovely. The staff were friendly, polite & helpful. The room was spacious, clean and had some very nice touches such as an ipod docking station, lots of reading material, very nice toiletries (including a rubber duck by the bath!) and a TV in the bathroom. When we returned from our evening out the bed was turned down, the curtains drawn and iced water left by the bed. The only thing missing was chocolates on the pillow! The only criticism we have regarding our stay was that for such an expensive & stylish hotel there is virtually no soundproofing between the rooms. You really can hear everything that goes on next door........ We would happily recommend this hotel but don't forget to pack ear plugs! Top Tip: If you intend to stay at this hotel at a weekend then you should check their rate directly. We found it is the same as through some discounted travel websites but includes breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: barbicangirl
Reviews.Content: Booked at the last minute as a suprise for my partner to celebrate good news & the guy on the 'phone said they could do something special. When I've previously stayed at One Aldwych we've been given a cake on my birthday or an upgrade. Nothing was provided at Threadneedles which is much emptier at the weekend. No major problems with the room ( other than uht milk): the "Friday night package" included champagne & rose petals. The "luxury chocolates" turned out to be Terry's all Gold which at least gave us a laugh given all the luxury chocolate shops nearby. The food was a let down. Dinner was ok & the service was good but in the morning I asked for a vegetarian breakfast & was told that on our package I could have the power breakfast without meat. On taking my first mouthful of mushroom I bit into a piece of blackpudding hidden beneath it, ugh! There was no assam tea at breakfast, we were given 2 tea bags & a pot of water, not what I expect at a 5 star hotel. The poached eggs were rock hard & I was glad to get home & make a decent pot of tea! We were thinking of booking for New Year's eve as Threadneedles is fairly local to us butafter this experience we won't be going back. As shame as there is a lot that'sgood about it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: Ange57
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was out of this world and felt very special. Everything was absolutely perfect - the room was amazing and the staff were really lovely. The Power Breakfast was delicious. Top marks all round! Definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant hotel in The City”
Reviews.Author: rosemaryoz
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in this hotel and found it to be well located, and very welcoming. All the staff were very helpful, no matter what our requests. The room was spacious, quiet and light, and the bathroom was very big.
