However, it was annoying to have to pay for breakfasts and internet access on top of a high room rate, unlike its competitor around the corner, the Hotel Andaz. But if you want to feel like you've stepped into a bit of London tradition, the magnificent glass dome ceiling in the lobby will set the tone straight away. The leather couches give you a feeling of being in a London 'club' and the comfort level is high throughout. It's close to plenty of London landmarks, and there are several good local dining choices, eg Gowings Wine Bar (mainly fish dishes, well cooked) and a great pub serving excellent steaks down the alleyway from the hotel (I know it's meant to be a proper street but most inner London streets seem like narrow alleys to me!) Overall, very welcoming, comfortable and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Good to so so for price”
Reviews.Author: maye1995
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Threadneedles for a week in August. Like other reviewers have said, if you are looking for a bustling area on the weekend, this is not the place. The streets/restaurants surrounding the hotel are quite literally bare on Saturday & Sunday. The Bank tube station is nearby, so getting somewhere to eat besides room service is fairly easy on the weekend. The room was spacious, nice bed linens and towels, small tv in the bathroom is a nice touch. A fruit plate greeted us upon our arrival, apples, banana, grapes, orange and a kiwi. A few apples that I ate were replaced during my stay. Very clean overall. The pop up plug adaptor on the desk was helpful. Hotel staff was very friendly. Used room service a few times, food arrived fairly quickly. Things I didn't like so much; there was no where to plug the hair dryer in in the bathroom, bit odd I thought. Internet is not free, pricier hotels never seem to have free wireless internet, but they should. When I'm paying this price for a hotel it would be nice not to be nickeld and dimed quite so much. The key card I was given kept not working. I had to go to the front desk 4 times during my stay to have them reset my card. I've had cards stop working before but never that often. I could hear people stomping up and down the hall very well, and could hear room next door from the bathroom. All in all a nice place for sure, comfortable, but a bit underwhelming overall. Probably will not be back unless it's on the expense account.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: FredTravelVa
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Stayed only one night arriving late. Rooms are clean, and smartly appointed. Very stylish. Service was excellent. Voltage converters sent right up to the room. Only draw back is that the rooms are a bit dark. Excellent hotel for the business traveler; it is five stars. Very convenient to law firm of White & Case.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant quality and service - still!”
Reviews.Author: timaye
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Threadneedles Hotel again and was as impressed as the first time I stayed. Brilliantly clean and well maintained it was a joy to kick back and just enjoy the room. Ate Dinner in the Bonds restaurant - great food and service. Breakfast was similarly good. Like all hotels in a commercial London district it has great weekend rates and when you look at what you get it is great value.

Reviews.Title: “Super Chic”
Reviews.Author: Sherealone
Reviews.Content: This hotel was super chic. It's right in the heart of the best attractions, but on small side street, that's out of the way. The reception was warm and friendly, and were happy to meet all your expectations. The room was lavish and sexy. Perfect for my first time in London, as a New Yorker. Perfect ! A great getaway.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: l0ve2travelco
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. We didn't really hang much in the lobby, and for an American visiting London, the room was a good size compared to what I have had in the past. Very shiek - almost W-esque. Clean and everything felt new. The soaking tub and shower stall (a little bit small on the shower stall) made the new bathroom outstanding. It is in the business district, so there is not a whole lot to do right around the hotel (and our 2 drinks at the Pacific Oriental across the street for 40 pounds didn't inspire us to search very hard). The Bank Station and Monument Station are right there, so you can get anywhere pretty easy. The staff was VERY helpful - making reservations and mailing us some documents that we accidentally left behind. I would definitley recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Threadneedles is lovely”
Reviews.Author: Cazzarama
Reviews.Content: This was a really nice hideaway hotel in the city. The room was luxurious. I thought the room service menu didnt offer much, and neither did the food on offer for dinner (all food was supplied by Bonds restaurant next door). Nevertheless, it was great.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: mooYorkUK
Reviews.Content: Quite simply this is the nicest, best value hotel I have stayed in in London. My girlfriend and i had a fantastic stay with great service at all times. we got a free room upgrade and the breakfast (which we had in the room) was superb. Lovely and quiet at the weekend and easy to get into central London. highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Bank on it.”
Reviews.Author: J_and_A_1
Reviews.Content: We discovered this hotel on our last visit to London and thought it looked very nice. For our most recent trip to London, the rate for this hotel was pretty good compared to comparable West End hotels so we figured after several visits to London staying a little out of the way would be just fine for us. The hotel is very nice and attractive. The lobby has an outstanding handed painted glass dome that is very beautiful. The hotelâ€™s contemporary dÃ©cor is warm and relaxing and flows throughout the property. We had an executive room which is several room sizes up from the smallest room. It was a good size room but a little smaller then we thought it would be. The dÃ©cor was great, with nice earth tones and cool looking light fixtures that gave off a soft glow. The TV was too small and placed in a tall cage that blocked your view unless you were in the bed. Although not that important to us, it should be noted that the TV channel selections also were very limited when it came to foreign stations. The room also was beginning to show some minor wear and tear. Some nice artwork was on the walls, and overall it was a pleasant room to relax in. The large limestone bathroom was very nice with separate shower, heated towel rack, and flat screen TV. The one area that needs some improvement at this hotel is service. It was very inconsistent. Since it is a small hotel, it seems the front desk staff does everything from concierge to telephone operator. Some members of the staff were very good, some were not. The turn down service was also inconsistent, but when it was done right, it was very nice with a bucket of ice, large bottle of water and a lit candle in the bathroom. We stayed for seven nights so we had the chance to experience the area during the week and weekend. It is very quiet on the weekends with almost every store in the immediate area closed. The best place to go if you need something is Liverpool Station, a ten minute walk. During the week, the area is very active during the day but gets quiet fast at night. The Bank tube station is a three minute walk with multiple lines that can put you in many tourist areas in ten minutes. If you are a first time visitor to London, you may not want to stay here. If you have been to London before, this location could work out well for you. London is a very busy and crowded city, especially in the main tourist spots. A stay at Threadneedles allows you to stay at a nice modern design hotel, in a relaxing area, yet with access to all the fun pretty quickly via a great tube system.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Honesty Bar”
Reviews.Author: Propatria
Reviews.Content: This is without doubt the finest hotel that I have ever had the pleasure of staying in. It contrasts classical style with modern amenities in keeping with it's City of London locality. From the moment you enter the hotel from the bustle of Threadneedles Street you are enveloped in a calming opulence that both stimulates and soothes the senses. Your eyes are drawn to the magnificant stained glass dome as the attentive staff invite you to sit down as you check in. You are then guided to your room that is so superior to the ordinary that it beggars belief. But it's the touches that make this hotel so special. Like the complimentary business cards that you receive on arrival informing friends and associates that you are in residence, or the champagne, strawberries and rose petal bath that can be arranged for the romantics. And make sure you have a meal in the restaurant- Brownes, it is outstanding and one of London's best kept secrets. As is the bar wihich is a hive of activity in the early evening as brokers and bankers converge after a busy day. And if you come in late then head to the Honesty Bar and help yourself to whatever you like. And if you are honest (like me) write it down in the book and then settle into the sumptuous chairs under the dome to the gentle sound of Cafe del Mar and pass the late evening in the company of friends. This is a truely exceptional hotel, run by a great hotelier and his very friendly helpful team.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: BAH3
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from staying at the Threadneedles. The decor is lovely and a nice grand reception but, I have to agree with the reviewer that said this doesn't live up to its 5 star rating and the rate you pay. We had difficulties ordering room service, which then took a long time to arrive and was tiny and half cooked. For a breakfast that came to around Â£45 for 2 it was very disappointing. The staff generally did not live up to what a hotel of this calibre should manage including the lack of offer of help with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: Magarta
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend here for a special occassion and it exceeded all expectations. The Executive room was huge and the rose petals on the bed and champange on arrival certainly did the job! Staff were friendly, and as we were there on the weekend the place was very quiet which gave the place a very relaxing feel. Will definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful treat...”
Reviews.Author: trloolavery
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night for our anniversary. It was a gorgeous hotel. The attention to detail was fantastic. Room service good and I highly recommend the American breakfast...mmmm...very yummy. Overall it was a real treat. The rooms were decorated beautifully, TV in bathroom was a treat (esp as the rugby semi-final was on!). Infact the room was so nice we decided to stay in instead of go out for the evening. The only thing was that I would not recommend it for children as the windows opened from the bottom up and led straight out onto a very small ledge and then onto....air! However, for us on an anniversary treat without our children it was not a problem atall. Pleasant, friendly staff and very clean. Overall 5 stars from us!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Minsters041
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in the hotel, the room was good with a decent LCD TV. The bathroom was excellent with a large bath and a great walk-in shower, the LCD TV in the bathroom was also a nice touch. The breakfast was excellent and the decor of the hotel was amazing. I am hard to please but this hotel impressed me. The only thing to be aware of is at weekends in the City where this hotel is located none of the shops, cafes or restaurants are open, however it is just a tube trip to these amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Bring earplugs”
Reviews.Author: Frankie-the-Hun
Reviews.Content: After reading the euphoric reviews on this page I was surprised when I arrived. Heaving our heavy luggage over the entrance steps (handicapped guests beware) no one made a point of giving us any assistance. I don't want to exaggerate, it's only three steps, but well... This kind of indifference was our continuous experience. We had problems with the TV, causing some grimacing at the reception, but yes, they were resolved... after a while. The affluent twenty-something who needs a Louis Vuitton sales rep coming to her room (a service the hotel might get a hefty commission for) will be satisfied. The non-deaf might have a hard time sleeping as various London bus lines are roaring through Threadneedle street (and yes, they do have night bus lines here, too). Bring earplugs. If the bus doesn't, the twenty-somethings will keep you from sleeping. Nice soap, nice rooms, big beds. There are not many places like this in the City of London. But it must have been a long way down from what I read on this page to where I have been.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: KLBYork
Reviews.Content: My Husbdand and I stayed at this hotel for a Saturday night in September. We have stayed in many similarly rated hotels in London and this was definately the best. We highly recommend it for tourists and business travellers. The hotel is a beautiful building both inside and out. It is lavishly decorated and the hotel has made the most of the building's period features. We booked a studio suite and were suitably impressed when we saw our room. It was very spacious, modern yet lavish decoration, and had everything you could expect from a 5 star hotel. We didn't eat in the hotel, however the restaurant looked impressive. Staff couldn't be more helpful. The hotel is quite pricey, however we would definately choose to stay in this hotel over other 5 stars in London. As it is in the heart of the City, the shops in the area are closed at weekends and it is very quiet, so it's helpful that it is so close to Bank station and it is very easy to get to all the major tourist attractions. We felt that the quality of the hotel was far superior to the 5 stars in more convenient loations, such as Mayfair or Oxford Circus etc for a similar price. The only downside to this hotel is that similarly to other prestigious hotels in London, the hotel does not have it's own car park. It is quite difficult to find. (A valet service would definately be helpful.) We parked in 140 London Wall Car park - which is at the London Wall Museum and is about a 10-15 minute walk away from the hotel. This car park was quite a find as it was a fixed fee of Â£3 for overnight parking at weekends. We are used to paying Â£20 to Â£30 per day in central London! Overall, we highly recommend this hotel and will definately be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Another stay at a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bronco1020
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Threadneedles at a minimum once a month when in London on business. Itâ€™s the only hotel I ever consider staying. This hotel could write the book on customer service. The doorman makes it a point to know my name, the hotel staff even stands up as you enter the building or leave the elevator. In a time where customer service is a lost art, this hotel gets it right and then some. I spend lots of time in hotels, so I know something on this subject, and I can 100% say this hotel will do you right and you will not be disappointed. I am not a person to normally give glowing reviews, but I am more than happy to recommend this hotel to anyone. Stay here for a very nice stayâ€¦just like home.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: laurenpSurrey
Reviews.Content: What can I say! It really is an amazing hotel and i'd recommend it to anyone! I took my boyfriend there for his birthday as we were going to the Oxo Tower for dinner and from the time we arrived we were smiling! The staff were fantastically helpful and we were even given a room upgrade to a studio which was beautiful!! The bed (and room in general) was huge! We booked directly through the hotel as you get breakfast in Bonds Restaurant doing it that way (which was also fab!!). The hotel is really near Bank staion and only about a 5 min walk from St Pauls so great location. We really did have a brilliant weekend and we didnt want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “5-star in every respect and some!”
Reviews.Author: Carrie100
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Threadneedles for one night on June 9th 2007 and this hotel exceeded my expectations in every respect. The location was excellent for me and my friend, as its a short (15 min) taxi ride to High Holborn (and shorter still to St. Pauls Cathedral), where you could get out and grab a tube to Covent Garden or even walk from Holborn to Covent Grden or Leicester Square. The hotel is also close for The Gherkin and Lloyds of London buildings, for those interested in modern architecture. The building is a former banking house, and the owners have refurbished it into a sleek, comfortable, modern yet welcoming style. There is lots of lovely walnut everywhere, and the rooms are really luxurious. We booked a deluxe double room but were delighted to be upgraded to room 106, the Shackleton Suite. The bed was huge, the bedlinen stylish and comfortable and it was very comfortable and quiet. The bathroom had a large bath and big shower, and lots of lovely Korres toiletries, as well as robes and fluffy towels. There was a sitting area with a flatscreen tv, wi-fi for internet connection and a CD/DVD player in the bedroom! The air con worked perfectly, and there was everything we could possibly need. You receive complimentary mineral water and a lighted candle on turn-down, and papers too. We found the staff to be very attentive (the front reception staff stand up when you first arrive and when you approach from the lifts...we felt like royalty, but it was clearly part of the hotel's approach to providing courteous and attentive service....other hotels should take note! Threadneedles Hotel has got it sussed!), friendly and accomodating. The wi-fi internet access on our t.v. didn't work, so they sent a porter immediately. When he couldn't fix it, they allowed me to have internet access from the reception office and did not charge me a cent. The breakfast was delicious - again, the attention to detail was excellent (the cooked breakfast was laid out beautifully on the plate and tasted great, so they got it right on presentation and quality.) I felt thoroughly spoilt staying here and while I accept that this is a 5-star hotel and costs quite a lot, if you are interested in service, quality and beautiful surroundings, as well as a pretty good location, I'd recommend this hotel very highly. A final footnote: I left a brand new pair of sunglasses behind, and they are posting them back to me! Anywhere else and you'd be lucky if they even bothered to look for them, and it would be more likely that they'd never be "found". Try Threadneedles...its beyond compare in my opinion (and I've stayed at The Savoy, The Ritz and many other so-called 5-star hotels who don't come anywhere near it.)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: americaninengland
Reviews.Content: I surprised my new husband with a night at Threadneedles. Due to the fact it was a holiday weekend, we got a great price for the delux king room. There was tons of space in the room, the bed was very comfy (though I would have have liked a king bed instead of the two twins pushed together). The bathroom was wonderful - a bath which was perfect for our bubble bath and the shower was huge! I was given the opportunity to help with a marketing survey and was given a bottle of Mumm for my trouble. It's a very customer driven hotel and I felt the warmth from the moment I entered until I left. It's easy to get around London from this hotel as you are surrounded by transportation options. It's one I would recommend to family and friends!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_2002uk
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Threadneedles hotel for the weekend of my birthday and I have to say it was fantastic. We got a bargain through london town website and saved over Â£200 on their standard rate. We booked a superior room and were gobsmacked upon entering, the room was stunning and had classical music playing in the background! We even had our own business cards saying we were in residence, with the direct dial to our room printed on! I was very impressed with the mini bar selection, ok it was a little pricey but not outragous. After our fab night out at the comedy store, we arrived back at the room to find our slippers laid out, an ice bucket, 2 glasses and a bottle of water - it was just what I needed! In the morning our paper arrived promptly and we went for breakfast. I recommend the power breakfast which is yummy! All in all I had a wonderful night here and would love to go back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tristram83
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Threadneedles hotel the other weekend and stayed for 2 nights. I would really recommend this hotel; upon arrival we were greeted by two reception staff who informed us that we had a complimentary room upgrade. Once in the room we had all the usual plus a LCD TV in the bathroom with a pile of magazines including ones about London which we found really helpful. The hotel provided us with complimentary still water and ice every afternoon which was nice to come back to after sightseeing in the 80 degree heat. Be warned the hotel is in the City of London which totally closes down at the weekend, however the hotel is very close to the Bank tube stop which mean you can be in the centre of London within minutes! All in all I loved this hotel I will definitely stay here again when I return to London.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: dervie
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent one night at The Threadneedles in January and had a wonderful time. Location: In the heart of London City this hotel is located 2mins walk from Bank Tube Station. Because of this, the hotel and surrounding area is very quiet at weekends but only a short distance from Covent Garden so this did not bother us. Lobby: Large spacious area with a beautiful dome in the middle. Seating area with lots of comfy chairs and tables and a self service bar for guests. Modern and traditional all rolled in to one. Rooms: Decent size for London although not exactly large. Bed was the comfiest I had ever slept in â€“ sheets were really soft. Facilities included; fully stocked mini bar, TV/DVD player in room, mini plasma in the bathroom, magazines and toiletries, 24hr room service, Louis Vuitton Concierge Service, tea/coffee with a wide range of choices, lots of wardrobe space with dressing gowns and slippers, bottled water and fruit etc etc. Everything in the rooms was spotlessly clean. Bar & Restaurant: As mentioned, London City area is very quiet at the weekend and for that reason the hotelâ€™s Bonds Bar & Restaurant is only opened for breakfast at weekends. The breakfast itself was incredibly fresh and with a choice of anything you could think of. Service: The service at The Threadneedles was impeccable and everything you would expect from a 5* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable quality - understated luxury”
Reviews.Author: dmerry
Reviews.Content: I had to do a few days work in London over the Easter weekend and needed to be near my client location. Threadneedles was my second choice, with serviced apartments being unavailable. I was delighted to feel that from the moment I arrived, the hotel staff were tripping over themselves to please me. The surprisingly quiet foyer area is beautiful with a stunning dome worthy of spending half an hour with a drink to admire. The room was very comfortable and everything had been thought of (like the TV in the bathroom was at the perfect angle to watch in the bath). There are only two (hopefully constructive) criticisms I could make; 1) The AC was very loud in the room. 2) The mini bar prices were just a bit too steep. My stay was very pleasant and I would definitely stay there again, but even though the quality was excellent - I'm not sure I'd choose to pay the full weekly rate (as opposed to the lower weekend rate) then again maybe Iâ€™m just tight.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous boutique hotel in the City”
Reviews.Author: Tripper43
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel has everything. If you are looking for a weekend stay in London and don't mind being in the (quiet) City, then this is perfect. Beautifully decorated, stunning lobby with a stained glass cupola, it's the epitome of the trendy boutique hotel. But trendy doesn't mean frosty, as the staff are friendly and helpful. The gorgeous rooms have lots of enticing little extras. My husband was particularly taken with the overnight shoe polishing service as the soes came back on a tray w ith the toes wrapped in tissue paper. If you can get a good weekend rate (we paid Â£160 inc breakfast ex VAT) and don't mind being a little out of the way (albeit within spitting distance of Bank tube on the central line) then this is gem and way better than you'd get in the average west end tourist trap.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms/ amenities and service just fair”
Reviews.Author: Famcruise
Reviews.Content: The lobby and the rooms are modern, fresh, and really quite stunning. The amenities in the rooms themselves are also excellent--top notch products and even a lit bathtub candle during turnaround. Everything else, though, is substandard for a five-star hotel. Europeans may find the service acceptable, but this property couldn't even begin to compare to a typical Four Seasons or even a Ritz-Carlton. The service is lackluster and amateur. The hotel contains no gym; you have to trek several blocks away to a large, sweaty, old property (that costs 12 pounds). On the weekends, the service here is even worse; the restaurant is closed entirely and you're limited to an extremely limited room-service menu. Not to mention that The City of London is completely dead on the weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay, couldnt be better”
Reviews.Author: rymetymeuk
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at this hotel for 2 nights for New Years Eve 2006, and it was fairly easy to get to from Bank tube. I totally recommend this hotel, the room was large and clean. the service attentive but possibly a little too friendly (they greet u when you walk in the front door, which i found a little too much), but overall its a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: J10
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for three days and enjoyed it tremendously The hotel is situated in the business area, which means you have to take the Tube or a taxi if you want to go out in the evening. We ordered some food from the hotel one night since the restaurant in the hotel was closed and we were too tired to venture the journey into the centre. This was not a great culinary experience, but convenient. The friendly service and the great atmosphere of the place, however, greatly outweighed the bad burgers that they serve and we would highly recommend the place.
